Sub: Notice of the 9th Annual General Meeting and Integrated Annual Report for FY2025 
 
Dear Sir/Madam,  
 
Pursuant to the provisions of Regulation 30 and 34 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and 
Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 and further to our letter today informing about the 
9th Annual General Meeting ("AGM") of the Company scheduled to be held on Thursday, 
September 18, 2025 at 1700 hrs. (IST) through Video Conference ("VC") / Other Audio Visual 
Means ("OAVM") in compliance with circulars issued by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (‘MCA”) 
and Securities and Exchange Board of India (“SEBI") in this regard, we wish to inform the 
following: 
 
1. The Integrated Annual Report for FY2025 and the notice of AGM have been sent today, i.e., 
Wednesday, August 27, 2025, through electronic mode to all the members of the Company 
whose email addresses are registered with the Company, Registrar & Transfer Agent (“RTA”) 
or the Depository Participants (“DP”). These documents are also available on the Company's 
website at www.maxestates.in.    
 
2. The entire shareholding of the Company is in Demat form.  
 
3. The Company is providing the facility to vote by electronic means (remote e-voting as well 
as e-voting at the AGM) on all the resolutions set out in the AGM notice to the members, 
who are holding shares on the cut-off date, i.e. Thursday, September 11, 2025. The remote 
e-voting will commence from Monday, September 15, 2025, at 0900 hrs. (IST) and shall end 
on Wednesday, September 17, 2025, at 1700 hrs. (IST). Detailed instructions for email 
address registration and voting/attendance at the AGM have been provided in the AGM 
Notice. 
 
4. The Integrated Annual Report for the FY2025 and the Notice of AGM are enclosed herewith. 
 
This is for your information and records. 
 
Thanking you,   
  
Yours faithfully,

What’s Inside
MAX SQUARE 
Actual Image
At Max Estates, we believe that spaces should elevate how people live, work, and 
thrive. Guided by our theme for 2025, “Redefining Spaces, Pioneering Wellbeing,” 
we are committed to shaping a future where real estate is not defined by square 
footage but by the quality of life it fosters.
Our approach reimagines real estate as a catalyst for holistic wellness, designing 
interconnected environments that foster collaboration, innovation, and community. 
Whether through immersive LiveWell homes or thoughtfully designed WorkWell 
offices, wellbeing is not an afterthought but the very foundation of our vision.
Rooted in our core values of Sevabhav, Excellence, and Credibility, we strive to 
create environments where design aligns with intent and growth serves a greater 
purpose. Our LiveWell, WorkWell philosophy supports intergenerational harmony 
in homes and enhances commercial spaces for productivity and vitality—truly 
pioneering a new paradigm of wellbeing in the built environment.
Our developments, from wellness-certified office spaces like Max Square, Max 
Towers, and Max House to community-focused residential projects such as Estate 
128 and Estate 360, demonstrate our commitment to redefining spaces that 
promote physical, emotional, social, and environmental wellness. In this report, 
we outline how Max Estates is intentionally and thoughtfully redefining real 
estate and urban living, focusing on holistic wellbeing and delivering tangible and 
transformative value.

About the Report
Reporting Period
Approach to Reporting
Reporting Scope 
and Boundary
Reporting Frameworks
April 1, 2024, to March 31, 2025
Max Estates Limited (“Max Estates”, “MEL”, “the Company”) is committed to transparent stakeholder 
communication and creating value for all its stakeholders in the short, medium, and long term. The 
Company presents its inaugural Integrated Annual Report, aligned with the International Integrated 
Reporting <IR> Framework. The report details the Company’s achievements, value-creation model, 
governance, operational context, performance, strategy, and material issues across six capitals: financial, 
manufactured, intellectual, human, social and relationship, and natural. This integrated approach 
underscores its dedication to sustainable business practices, addressing environmental and social 
challenges alongside financial metrics. The report highlights the performance against key indicators, 
emphasising  the connectivity and transparency of information relevant to the Company’s operations.
The report covers the period from April 
1, 2024, to March 31, 2025. It details the 
Company’s primary activities across all 
operating regions, business segments, and 
key support functions.
This report aligns with the principles and guidelines of the:
International Integrated 
Reporting <IR> framework 
of the IFRS Foundation
Securities and Exchange Board of India 
(Listing Obligations and Disclosure 
Requirements) Regulations, 2015
United Nations 
Sustainable Development 
Goals (UN SDGs)
The Companies Act, 2013 
(and the rules made 
thereunder)
Indian Accounting Standards 
and International Financial 
Reporting Standards
Financial and 
Non-financial Reporting
This report provides a comprehensive view 
of financial and non-financial performance, 
encompassing opportunities, risks, and 
stakeholder impacts that influence value 
creation and affect the business model 
and strategic objectives. It highlights 
performance against established 
plans, illustrates resource utilisation in 
achieving objectives, and highlights areas 
for improvement.

MAX ESTATES LIMITED
Capitals
Board of Directors’ Assurance
This report uses the six capitals, as defined by 
the International <IR> Framework, to provide a 
comprehensive understanding of Max Estates’ 
functioning and value creation process.
Stakeholders
Max Estates has identified and engaged with a 
diverse group of stakeholders who are integral to 
the Company’s long-term success. These include 
investors, shareholders, and financial institutions 
who provide capital and confidence; tenants, 
customers, and end-users who experience the 
value of its offerings; and employees along with 
third-party contractors who drive its operations. The 
Company also engages closely with government 
agencies, regulators, and industry bodies to 
ensure compliance and alignment with broader 
industry standards. Its ecosystem further extends 
to suppliers, vendors, and channel partners who 
support its business continuity; communities and 
social organisations with whom it collaborates 
to create a positive social impact; and the media 
and public communication platforms that shape 
perceptions and outreach. This comprehensive 
approach ensures that the report reflects 
perspectives that matter most to those connected 
with Max Estates.
Materiality
The report for FY2025 highlights the key factors 
that influence stakeholder value creation. In this 
financial year, Max Estates categorised its material 
topics under four broad themes: Economy, 
Environment, Social, and Governance. These were 
identified through a detailed analysis of risks and 
opportunities, identifying key stakeholders, and 
engaging regularly to address their concerns.
The Audit Committee and the Board of Directors of 
Max Estates confirms that this report for the year 
ended March 31, 2025, presents a fair and balanced 
account of the Company’s strategy, performance, 
and value creation. It has been prepared in line with 
the International <IR> Framework and applicable 
regulatory requirements.
The Board has reviewed and approved this report 
and remains committed to upholding transparency, 
accountability and long-term value creation for 
all stakeholders.
Precautionary Principle
Forward-looking Statement
Max Estates recognises that its most significant 
environmental impacts arise from construction 
activities, building operations, and the overall 
development portfolio. The Company continues to 
grow its sustainability practices through the use 
of low-carbon materials, energy-efficient design, 
and collaboration with suppliers, contractors, 
and tenants.

language. These reflect the Company’s vision 
as of the date of this document. Max Estates is 
under no obligation to revise or publicly update 
these statements based on subsequent events.

Message from the 
Chairman and MD
LETTER TO THE SHAREHOLDERS
Dear Shareholders,
It is both an honour and a privilege to present our inaugural Integrated 
Annual Report as we mark a milestone year of purposeful growth and 
meaningful expansion. The theme, “Redefining Spaces, Pioneering 
Wellbeing”, captures the essence of our journey as we step into a new 
phase shaped by scale, clarity, sustainability, and execution.
FY2025 marks the beginning of Max Estates’ 3.0 execution phase. 
This was a strategic shift from being a single-project developer 
to becoming a purpose-driven real estate organisation delivering 
multiple large-scale projects across Delhi NCR.
This evolution has been grounded in capital discipline, capability 
enhancement, and an unwavering belief in our vision of bringing 
real wellbeing into real estate.
Global and Domestic Context: 
Resilience Amid Uncertainty
The global economic environment in 2024 remained 
complex and uneven. Several large economies faced 
long-term challenges. The United States stayed resilient, 
backed by consumer demand. Europe struggled to 
regain momentum and China’s real estate sector 
remained under pressure.
India, in contrast, outperformed global trends. Our 
economy remained stable with a positive outlook. GDP 
grew at an estimated 6.5%, making India one of the 
fastest-growing major economies in the world. Inflation 
eased, private and public investments picked up pace, 
and structural reforms continued to advance. Together, 
these factors strengthened India’s standing as a resilient, 
reliable growth engine in a challenging global context.
India’s real estate sector reflected this momentum. 
Institutional investments rose to $8.9 billion, a 51% 
increase over the previous year. Despite constrained 
supply, residential sales remained strong. The sector 
continues to be a key pillar to India’s economic and 
employment ecosystem.
The residential market saw a clear shift towards premium 
and luxury homes, driven by rising aspirations, greater 
affordability, and growing trust in branded developers. 
Commercial real estate also saw record momentum. 
India reached its highest-ever gross leasing volume 
of 79 million square feet, reflecting strong occupier 
confidence and the country’s rising appeal as a 
destination for Global Capability Centres (GCCs).
Scaling with Purpose: 
The Max Estates 3.0 Journey
As the market continues to evolve, we continue to 
grow with intention. The Max Estates 3.0 journey 
is grounded in strong fundamentals, including a 
focus on strategic locations and wellbeing-enabled 
ecosystems, high-quality design, customer-first 
experiences, and disciplined use of capital. This 
approach strengthens our foundation as a forward-
thinking real estate brand, ready to lead with 
purpose and clarity.
In line with our approach, FY2025 was a defining 
year for Max Estates—a year of moving from 
preparation to execution, from planning to 
performance, marking milestones across these 
key pillars.
	»
Our total portfolio grew from 8 million to over 
17.1 million square feet, with a balanced mix 
of residential, commercial, and mixed-use 
developments across Noida, Gurugram, and 
Delhi. We evolved from managing one project 
to overseeing four operational assets, four under 
construction, and three in design. We acquired 
prime land and development rights across Delhi 
NCR, enhancing our vision to redefine real estate 
with contemporary design and a hospitality-led 
experience. This growth was shaped by deliberate 
strategic choices, rooted in product quality, 
innovation, and holistic customer experience.
India, in contrast, 
outperformed global trends. 
Our economy remained 
stable with a positive 
outlook. GDP grew at an 
estimated 6.5%, making 
India one of the fastest-
growing major economies 
in the world.
Mr. Analjit Singh 
Founder & Chairman, 
Max Group
Mr. Sahil Vachani 
Vice Chairman & 
Managing Director, 
Max Estates

Integrated Annual Report 2024-25
Corporate Overview
Statutory Statements
Financial Statements
We witnessed strong momentum in the residential 
segment. Pre-sales crossed ₹5,300 crore, a threefold 
rise from the previous year. Among our residential 
(LiveWell) offerings, Estate 128 in Noida is now fully 
sold, with Phase II launched at over 40% premium 
to Phase I, reaffirming the value of thoughtful 
design and customer-first experiences in residential 
communities. Estate 360 in Gurugram, Delhi NCR’s 
first intergenerational living concept, also saw a 
strong response. With 96% of its inventory sold, it 
recorded ₹4,634 crore in sales. Together, collections 
crossed ₹980 crore. It was a clear reflection of our 
execution and customer-centric approach.
In the commercial segment, we focused on creating 
spaces that deliver high-quality, differentiated 
experiences. Max Square in Noida reached over 
99% leasing, at a 30% rental premium to its micro-
market. Max House Phase II in Delhi reached full 
occupancy within 12 months, at a 60% premium. 
Our commercial portfolio now spans over 6 
million square feet across delivered, ongoing, and 
upcoming developments. Together, they carry a 
peak annuity rental potential of ₹720 crore. Each of 
our commercial assets is fully leased and home to a 
diverse mix of tenants. No single occupier holds more 
than 25% of space in any development, reaffirming 
that our leasing model remains resilient and built 
to last.
Capital Strength and Strategic Partnerships
FY2025 was also a year of strengthening our capital 
base. We raised over ₹1,300 crore of fresh capital 
through a Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP), 
strategic investor participations, and sponsor capital 
commitments. The QIP alone accounted for ₹800 
crore, with strong participation from marquee 
institutional investors. It signalled trust in our 
business model, our ability to deliver, and the long-
term direction we are building towards.
Our partnership with New York Life Insurance Company 
(NYL) also grew deeper. With a cumulative investment 
commitment of ₹1,800 crore, NYL now holds a 49% 
stake across our entire commercial portfolio, including 
upcoming mixed-use developments in Noida. Their 
partnership goes beyond capital. It is built on shared 
values, highest level of governance, aligned intent, and 
a belief in long-term value creation.
Together, these capital initiatives have fortified our 
balance sheet. As of March 31, 2025, we were net debt-
positive, with a cash surplus of ₹435 crore. This gives us 
the headroom to pursue new opportunities, manage 
risks with care, and continue scaling in a thoughtful, 
sustainable way.
Strengthening the Foundation 
for Execution at Scale
Our ability to deliver at scale is rooted in the strength 
of our people, structured processes, robust technology, 
and sound governance. This year, we onboarded over 
120 professionals across functions, with focused hiring 
for the residential vertical. We also took steady steps 
toward building more inclusive teams, improving 
gender diversity across functions, and setting a clear 
target of 30% women’s representation over the next 
24 months.
We partnered with In Tandem Global Consulting to 
co-author, “Concrete Change—A Study of the Economic 
Impact of Better Pay Parity & Inclusion of Women in 
Real Estate”. This is not just a milestone for the industry, 
but a reaffirmation of our belief that progress in 
business must go hand in hand with social progress.
To support consistent quality across projects, we 
institutionalised SOPs across 13 verticals of the real 
estate value chain. These were rigorously tested 
through internal audits to ensure operational rigour. 
Our digital roadmap continues to guide us across core 
functions, enabling greater project visibility, real-time 
decision-making, sharper operational efficiency, and 
enhanced stakeholder experience. We now use a 
suite of tools such as SAP, BIM, Salesforce, Zoho, and 
Autodesk to further strengthen our execution across 
the value chain.
On the sustainability front, we are working across 
the portfolio to conserve energy and water, reduce 
emissions, and minimise waste. We have already set 
reduction targets for Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions, 
while actively baselining Scope 3 net zero targets.
On governance, we have continued to strengthen 
our Board with individuals who bring deep, cross-
sectoral expertise and strategic insight. Their guidance 
ensures disciplined capital allocation, thoughtful risk 
management, and a steady focus on long-term value 
creation. To deepen this focus, we welcomed Atul B. 
Lall, Ira Gupta, Malini Thadani, and Anthony Ramsey 
Malloy to our Board.
Together, they bring strength in building at scale, 
leadership, culture, investing, and sustainability. Their 
combined insight will help us with execution at scale, 
enable adoption of technology , and strengthen 
governance through disciplined capital allocation, 
thoughtful risk management, and a focus on long-
term value creation.
Creating Holistic Experiences 
with Purpose
At Max Estates, we believe real estate is about more 
than just structures. It is about the lived experiences 
and the wellbeing of the tenants. Our design-led, 
hospitality-driven approach brings our WorkWell 
and LiveWell philosophy to life, weaving in nature, 
community, wellness, and sustainability across all 
our offerings.
Sustainability remains central to who we are. This 
year, we secured LEED, WELL, and IGBC certifications 
across operational assets and are now working 
towards a 5-star GRESB rating in 2025. We are also 
aligning our net zero goals with the Science-Based 
Targets Initiative (SBTi) and have committed to 
reaching net zero emissions for both Scope 1 and 
Scope 2 by 2040.
The central forest courtyard at Max Square, spanning 
over 11,000 square feet serves as a living example 
of biophilia in commercial real estate. Through our 
in-house engagement vertical, Pulse, we hosted over 
200 events, reaching more than 8,400 people and 
contributing to a Net Promoter Score (NPS) of 6.9 
out of 10.
Beyond business, we continue to invest in positive 
social impact. Through our partnership with Habitat 
for Humanity, we have provided over 25 homes to 
underprivileged workers in Rewari, with 25 more 
underway. Our collaboration with the Latika Roy 
Foundation has resulted in a 56,000-square-foot, 
universally accessible space, the “Centre for Inclusion 
and Influence”, reaffirming our commitment to 
inclusive growth.
We are building a culture that puts people at the 
centre, helping us shape a workforce that is future-
ready. From structured performance frameworks 
to leadership development and digital skilling, 
our initiatives are designed to support growth, 
well-being, equity, and inclusion. With initiatives 
across leadership development, ESG integration, 
digital transformation, and holistic retention, we are 
nurturing a culture aligned with our vision, growth, 
and sustainability goals.
Looking Ahead: 
Ambition Meets Discipline
We are entering FY2026 with our eyes on growth, 
and our feet on firm ground. Our priorities are 
clear: grow pre-sales by 15–20%, and launch 
three new offerings—Estate 360, Delhi One, and 
Sector 105, adding at least 3 million square feet 
of fresh opportunities every year. We will continue 
to advance construction across ongoing projects, 
pursue financial closures for key mixed-use offerings, 
and deepen the use of digital systems and ESG 
best practices.
What we build says everything 
about who we are.
The path ahead calls for ambition, but also for care, 
clarity, and a commitment to doing right by the 
people and places we shape. At Max Estates, we 
believe our spaces should breathe. They should 
nurture, restore, and belong. Through every project, 
we stay committed to creating long-term value and 
improving quality of life, while placing wellbeing at 
the core. We are not just a real estate brand. We are 
here to craft offerings that inspire, empower, and 
enrich the lives of those who inhabit them.
To our investors, partners, customers, employees, 
and the larger ecosystem—thank you for standing 
with us, trusting us, and believing in what we are 
building. Together, we look ahead to a future rooted 
in wellbeing, shaped by intention, and made to last.
Warm regards,
Analjit Singh 
Founder & Chairman 
Max Group
Sahil Vachani 
Vice Chairman & Managing Director 
Max Estates

Financial Statements
Established in 2016, Max Estates is the real estate development arm 
of Max Group. In our journey to become the most preferred real estate 
brand in Delhi NCR, we remain guided by a singular idea: to create spaces 
that enhance wellbeing through exceptional experiences across both 
residential and commercial segments. We are anchored on the deep 
purpose of creating spaces that enhance quality of life.
Transformative Growth, 
Prioritising Value
FY2025: A Year of 
Expansion and Intent
FY2025 marked a significant phase of growth for 
Max Estates. We expanded our development portfolio 
from 8 million square feet in FY2024 to over 17 
million square feet in FY2025. Staying true to our core 
philosophies of LiveWell and WorkWell, we reaffirmed 
our strong conviction in the long-term potential of 
real estate in Delhi NCR.
This year was particularly notable as we entered 
the mixed-use development space through two 
marquee acquisitions. These additions further 
our vision of delivering differentiated real estate 
offerings that bring together thoughtful design and 
exceptional hospitality.
Max Estates continues to follow a focused strategy:
“One Region, Multiple Asset Classes”.
Our portfolio is well-diversified across:
	»
Geography, spanning Delhi NCR, including 
Gurugram, Noida, and Delhi
	»
Asset classes, covering residential, commercial, and 
mixed-use developments
	»
Risk spectrum, with projects that are delivered, 
under construction, or under design
In a region where credible, consumer-first 
developers are few, we aim to bridge the gap by 
creating holistic, design-led, and hospitality-driven 
experiences that respond to people’s needs.
For us, expansion is never just 
about scaling up in size. It is about 
thoughtfully reshaping real estate 
with care, creating spaces that 
nurture our communities and the 
planet alike.
Mission
	»
Enhance quality of life through exceptional design, 
sustainability, and meaningful experiences.
	»
Stay agile and responsive to an evolving 
external environment.
	»
Build a workplace that attracts, nurtures, and 
retains exceptional talent.
	»
Be the most preferred choice for all stakeholders, 
including customers, communities, shareholders, 
and employees.
	»
Lead the market in using technology to deliver 
world-class spaces.
	»
Uphold the highest standards of governance.

We design for wellbeing by staying in tune with our customers’ evolving expectations. Our solutions 
are thoughtful, accessible, and rooted in research. Studies show that the built environment can directly 
influence quality of life. A well-designed space can uplift health, support connection, and make everyday 
life easier. We focus on creating environments that inspire collaboration, spark innovation, and foster 
community. Every Max Estates offering brings together aesthetics, sustainability, and experiences. Our 
spaces support the full spectrum of wellbeing be it physical, emotional, social, or environmental. We are 
committed to thoughtfully bringing a wellness-first approach to people’s life.

Geographic Footprint
Max Estates carefully selects locations across Delhi NCR’s vibrant growth corridors. Each site is 
chosen for its strong connectivity, market potential, and alignment with our vision for wellness-first, 
sustainable development.
Noida: Max Square, Max Square Two, 
Max Towers, Estate 128, Delhi One, 
Sector 105
Gurugram: Max District, 
Estate 360, Estate 361
Delhi: Max House
Market Presence
Max Estates has quickly established a strong 
presence in Delhi NCR by focusing on Grade-A, 
wellness-oriented offerings in the region’s fastest-
growing micro-markets. With the financial strength 
and legacy of Max Group behind us, our land 
acquisitions in Noida and Gurugram reflect a deep 
understanding of evolving needs for thoughtful, 
community-centric spaces.
Supported by a team of over 200 full time 
professionals, a zero net-debt balance sheet, and 
tech-led operations with sustainability at the core, 
we are well-placed to deliver at scale. We currently 
operate four assets, with construction underway on 
four large developments and three more in design.
We are also committed to creating a positive 
societal impact. In partnership with Habitat for 
Humanity India, we are helping provide dignified 
housing for underserved communities living in 
vulnerable conditions. The project will support 50 
families, offering safe shelter and a better quality 
of life.
Additionally, through our partnership with the 
Latika Roy Foundation to create the “Centre 
for Inclusion and Influence”,, we are reaffirming 
our commitment to building inclusive, universally 
accessible spaces for people of all abilities. A 56,000 
square feet campus is being developed, featuring 
activity rooms, therapy and counselling units, a 
library, physiotherapy and sensory areas, a family 
resource centre, inclusive playground, training halls, 
and a ramp-accessible building.

Our “One Region, Multiple Asset 
Classes” strategy reflects a deep 
commitment to building a more 
thoughtful and sustainable future 
through diverse, sustainable, and 
well-balanced offerings.
From fully delivered landmarks 
like Max Towers, Max House, 
and Max Square to upcoming 
developments in Gurugram and 
Noida, each space leverages smart 
technologies like IoT-enabled 
building systems, digital twin 
modelling, and prop-tech 
integrations. These improve 
energy use, enhance comfort, and 
simplify our operations.
Pioneering Smart and Sustainable Urban Living
Max Estates is shaping the future of urban living 
by blending together innovative technologies and 
sustainable design at every stage of development. In 
FY2025, we delivered strong operational performance 
across our portfolio, spanning completed projects, 
those nearing completion, and others still in the 
design phase.
Our efforts extend beyond technology. We are committed to making our buildings green-certifiable, 
and implementing rainwater harvesting and circular waste systems and solar-ready rooftops that reduce 
environmental impact and safeguard natural resources. By seamlessly integrating LiveWell and WorkWell 
principles across residential, commercial, and mixed-use spaces, Max Estates fosters balance and wellbeing. Each 
development is managed through a dedicated SPV, ensuring sharper focus and governance. This approach has 
allowed us to scale responsibly, meet evolving urban needs, and shape a smarter, more sustainable Delhi NCR.

31
Established in 2016, Max Estates Limited is the real 
estate arm of Max Group. With a vision to bring real 
wellbeing to real estate, Max Estates has curated 
a diversified portfolio of Grade A sustainable 
residential and commercial developments. These 
span across asset classes and key locations in 
Delhi NCR.
Highlights of Our Journey
In just a few years, Max Estates has brought meaningful 
change to the real estate sector. Our Grade A 
developer-managed commercial buildings are built on 
our signature WorkWell philosophy. Backed by our track 
record in commercial development, along with a clear 
design language, a differentiated end-user experience, 
and the governance strength of Max Group, we are now 
scaling both residential and commercial portfolios to 
deliver long-term value to all stakeholders.
In 2023, we launched our first residential development, 
Estate 128. It was a landmark success and gained 
recognition as a redefined experience in the luxury 
segment. A year later, in 2024, we introduced Estate 360 
in Gurugram. It was not only our first residential launch in 
the city, but also the first intergenerational offering of its 
kind in Delhi NCR.
FY2025 marked a period of strong growth. Our 
development portfolio expanded from 8 million 
square feet in FY2024 to over 17.1 million square feet. 
This included residential, commercial, and mixed-
use segments.
We also made a notable entry into the mixed-use space 
by acquiring prime land parcels and development 
rights across Delhi NCR. These moves reinforced our 
operational capabilities and deepened our presence in key 
growth corridors.
With our LiveWell and WorkWell philosophies at the core, 
Max Estates aims to add at least 3 million square feet to 
its portfolio every year. These philosophies guide how we 
design and operate in creating spaces for our customers.
As a wellbeing company enabled 
by real estate, Max Estates is 
committed to creating spaces that 
enable collaboration, innovation, 
and community. 
These spaces go beyond being 
just functional and aesthetically 
pleasing. They are environmentally 
sustainable and designed to 
promote holistic wellness for the 
people who live and work in them.
BUSINESS OVERVIEW
Innovating  
Spaces with Care
MAX HOUSE 
Actual Image
Operational Experiences
Max House, New Delhi
Max House sits in a well-connected part of South 
Delhi, echoing the design vocabulary of its industrial 
roots while reimagining them for a modern 
workforce. Spread across ~0.3 million square 
feet, this offering is LEED Gold-certified for Green 
Building strategies, IGBC Gold-rated for Health and 
Wellness aspects and WELL-rated for Health and 
Safety measures. The campus has a dedicated block 
for amenities which hosts a food and beverage 
destination, EatWell by Diva, as well as event spaces, 
a business centre, and multiple collaborative zones 
that foster connection, creativity, and community.
Max Towers, Noida
At the edge of South Delhi in Noida stands Max 
Towers, a 0.6 million square feet of commercial 
offerings designed to shape the future of workspaces. 
The building holds LEED Platinum certification 
for Green Building strategies and Operations and 
Maintenance. It also holds IGBC Platinum for health 
and wellness, and WELL certification for health and 
safety. Every element of the space is curated with 
care, from the in-house auditorium and 374-seater 
cafeteria to the early learning centre, vibrant food and 
beverage spaces, and sports facilities. Biophilia and 
art are woven through conscientiously to enhance 
the wellbeing of our customers. This offering is 100% 
leased to marquee clients across industries.
Max Square, Noida
Conceived from the image of cupped hands 
protecting a growing bud, Max Square brings the 
idea of nature and nurture to life. Located in Sector 
129 along the Noida–Greater Noida Expressway, one 
of Delhi NCR’s fastest-growing micro-markets, the 
development offers ~0.7 million square feet of unique 
office space. At its centre sits a ~11,000 square feet 
forest. It is IGBC Platinum-rated d for Green Building 
strategies, IGBC-rated for Health and Wellness, and 
WELL-rated for Health and Safety measures.
222 Rajpur, Dehradun
Nestled beside the Malsi forest with sweeping views 
of the Mussoorie Hills, 222 Rajpur is created for those 
who value privacy and quiet. Spread across 5 acres 
on Dehradun’s landmark Rajpur Road, this intimate 
community of just 22 villas provides a space to slow 
down and cherish life in a beautiful, natural setting.

32
MAX ESTATES LIMITED
Estate 360, Gurugram
Estate 360 is located in Sector 
36A, along the Dwarka Expressway 
in Gurugram. It embodies a 
unique approach to community 
living, one that honours every 
need and every generation. The 
development is pre-certified 
IGBC Platinum, and spread across 
nearly 11.8 acres, with a potential 
of around 2.4 million square feet. 
The offering spurs from an idea 
of “intergenerational residential 
community”. Two of the six 
residential offerings are dedicated 
to senior living, which will be 
managed by Antara, India’s only 
integrated senior care ecosystem. 
It houses a campus of over 100k 
square feet of amenities that 
caters to all ages, featuring two 
clubhouses, a sports block, and a 
car-free ground plaza for safety and 
reduced pollution.
Max Square Two, Noida
Max Square Two is coming up 
next to the existing Max Square 
campus. Spread across ~4 acres 
and pre-certified IGBC Platinum, 
it will offer a thoughtfully 
balanced mix of commercial 
and amenity spaces, spanning 
nearly 1.1 million square feet. 
The expanded campus will allow 
current tenants to grow within 
the same ecosystem, while 
inviting new ones to join. Its 
future-forward design enhances 
workplace experiences, with 
business centres, multipurpose 
halls, food and beverage spaces, a 
crèche, and more.
Estate 361, Gurugram
Expanding our footprint in 
Gurugram, we have an upcoming 
LiveWell development located 
in Sector 36A along the Dwarka 
Expressway. Spread across about 
18 acres with a development 
potential of ~4 million square 
feet, it is thoughtfully envisioned 
around our LiveWell philosophy. 
At the heart of the community 
lies a lush, 1+ acre forest. This 
green core will anchor the 
experience and support holistic 
wellness for every resident.
Max District, Gurugram
Max District draws inspiration from 
the timeless charm of a walled city. 
It seamlessly weaves structure and 
nature together, with an abundant 
garden flowing effortlessly from 
the outdoors into the heart of the 
space. Located along Golf Course 
Extension Road, the development 
covers nearly 1.6 million square 
feet. This is one of the most sought-
after locations in Delhi NCR, home 
to both Indian and multinational 
businesses Pre-certified LEED 
Platinum, this modern workspace 
seamlessly integrates sustainability 
with a diverse range of amenities, 
including food and beverage 
spaces, gyms, and wellness 
facilities, blurring the boundaries 
between work, wellbeing, 
and lifestyle.
Estate 128, Noida
Max Estates continues to scale 
its portfolio with thoughtfully 
curated upcoming offerings 
across Delhi NCR. Our upcoming 
LiveWell and WorkWell 
experiences in Delhi, Noida, and 
Gurugram are being built on the 
tenets of our operating philosophy 
centred around resident 
wellbeing. Located in Sector 128, 
Estate 128 is designed around a 
simple idea that wellbeing begins 
at home. Spread across 10 acres 
with ~1.4 million square feet of 
development, it offers expansive 
decks for bespoke outdoor 
experiences and amenities 
that encourage movement, 
connection, and interaction. With 
over 80% open spaces in the 
midst of the bustling cityscape, 
it offers a space to live well in the 
heart of the city.
Experiences Under Development
Sector 105, Noida
Located in Sector 105, Noida, 
our upcoming mixed-use 
offering spans 10+ acres with 
a development potential of 2.6 
million square feet. The offering 
comprises 60% residential and 
40% commercial space. With 
three open sides and a prominent 
75-metre frontage along the 
Noida–Greater Noida Expressway, 
the site offers excellent visibility 
and connectivity. Set within 
a growing residential and 
commercial micro-market, the 
offering will reflect our LiveWell 
and WorkWell philosophies, 
seamlessly weaving fitness, 
sports, and an active lifestyle 
into a thoughtfully curated 
urban experience.
Delhi One, Noida
Delhi One is envisioned as a vibrant, 
integrated campus, spanning 
across ~2.5 million square feet on an 
approximate 10-acre land parcel. It 
will be a downtown experience that 
will host ultra-luxury residences, 
premium office spaces, curated high 
street retail and exclusive club facilities, 
thoughtfully blending our philosophy 
of LiveWell, WorkWell, and PlayWell. 
Situated at the edge of South Delhi 
and directly connected via the Delhi-
Noida-Direct (DND) Flyway, the campus 
is also steps away from key metro 
stations, enhancing its connectivity and 
convenience across Delhi NCR.

The LiveWell and 
WorkWell Difference
At Max Estates, wellbeing is not an afterthought. It is 
at the heart of everything we build. Our LiveWell and 
WorkWell philosophy guides each step of development, 
from the way we design to how we deliver, ensuring 
every space nurtures the body, mind, and spirit.
Rooted in engineering excellence and supported 
by an experienced team, we combine a digital-first 
mindset with a deep sense of Sevabhav. This allows us 
to deliver hospitality-led experiences that go beyond 
what real estate typically offers. Each space is designed 
to support holistic well-being. That includes physical, 
emotional, social, and environmental needs.
From nature-filled, biophilic environments that soothe 
and restore, to thoughtfully placed amenities that 
support movement, nutrition, and rest, we build an 
ecosystem that focuses on your wellness. Our spaces 
encourage community and connection. They promote 
balance. And they are built to last with sustainability 
at the core of every decision. All our developments 
meet the highest standards of LEED, IGBC, and WELL, 
creating resilient, future-ready spaces that enhance 
quality of life.
Facility Management
At Max Estates, we follow a “developer-owned, 
developer-managed” philosophy. All our offerings are 
operated by Max Asset Services (MAS), a wholly owned 
subsidiary of Max Estates. MAS brings together a strong 
team of engineering excellence and technical expertise, 
along with a hospitality-first approach shaped by Max 
Group’s value of Sevabhav. This ensures that our service 
and interactions are marked by humility, empathy, 
and care.
Through its in-house engagement vertical, Pulse, 
MAS curates meaningful experiences that build a 
sense of belonging and well-being across all offerings. 
A dedicated culture management team leads 
community engagement programmes that nurture 
a vibrant ecosystem. These efforts reinforce our 
commitment to delivering a thoughtful WorkWell and 
LiveWell experience.
Special Purpose Vehicles (SPVs)
Our portfolio of 17.1 million square feet is structured as 
a house of nine SPVs. Each SPV represents a distinct 
project. This includes a mix of wholly owned entities 
and partnerships, particularly across commercial and 
mixed-use offerings where New York Life Insurance 
Company serves as a strategic partner.

Designing with Purpose. 
Delivering with Strategy. 
STRATEGY AND MANAGEMENT
Max Estates is reshaping real estate in Delhi NCR with a focus on people. 
Every residential and commercial offering is thoughtfully designed to 
prioritise comfort, wellbeing,  and ease of experience. 
At the heart of this approach is a wellness-first design philosophy. It is reflected in 
our wrap-around balconies and wide openings to natural light and fresh air, each 
element is intentional. Staying true to our LiveWell and WorkWell principles, we bring 
together sustainability, biophilic design, and a sense of community to create spaces 
that support modern life and enhance the quality of life for our community. With 
smart, ESG-led systems like AI-enabled HVAC, we focus on both performance and 
peace of mind.
Our aim is to go beyond aesthetics, create spaces 
that are highly functional, intuitively designed, 
and made to support everyday living. 
Frameworks Enhancing 
Business Growth
Our strategy is built on clear frameworks that guide how we grow. One key insight from FY2025 was 
the need for more nuanced offerings. Instead of following a one-size-fits-all model, we are designing for 
real people. Targeted offerings for distinct customers such as millennials and seniors, alongside the MEL 
signature product.
This approach helps us meet evolving needs with more empathy and precision. It is backed by weekly 
cross-functional reviews and frequent workshops with external experts. In FY2025, we also entered 
the mixed-use space through two landmark acquisitions. Each new step helps us create places where 
thoughtful design meets hospitality.

38
MAX ESTATES LIMITED
“One Region, Multiple Asset Classes”
Max Estates follows a focused “One Region, Multiple Asset Classes” strategy as it grows 
sustainably in Delhi NCR through a focused, diversified portfolio. With a presence across 
Noida, Gurugram, and Delhi, our portfolio of over 17 million square feet spans residential, 
commercial, and mixed-use spaces at various stages of development (delivered, under-
construction, and in-design).
This clarity of focus allows us to meet real demand with real impact. In a market that often 
prioritises scale over sensitivity, our design-led offerings are shaped by credibility, care, 
and our consumer-first approach. Flagship projects like Max Towers, Max House, and Max 
Square reflect this intent, showing strong leasing momentum and healthy rental yields.
As we are expanding our residential portfolio with offerings for millennials and senior 
living, our strategy remains anchored on maintaining a clear focus on capital efficiency 
and delivering long-term value with care and precision.
Integrated Portfolio Growth
Max Estates is building a future-ready real 
estate organisation, guided by six strategic 
pillars: People, Growth, Capital, Process, 
Brand, and Customer Centricity. Together, 
they support our ability to grow with 
agility, deliver with consistency, and create 
long-term value. In FY2025, we deepened 
our focus across these pillars to sharpen 
our approach and extend our momentum.
Wellness‑first Design
Max Estates continues to prioritise 
wellness-first design as a core growth 
strategy in FY2025. Guided by our 
LiveWell and WorkWell philosophies, we 
are committed to enhancing physical, 
emotional, social, and environmental 
wellbeing in every offering. This 
commitment comes through in elements 
such as the central forest courtyard at Max 
Square, advanced air and water quality 
systems, and thoughtfully integrated art 
and communal spaces.
Digital Enablement
Max Estates is driving digital innovation across 
the real estate lifecycle to enhance customer 
experience and operational efficiency. By 
using platforms like SAP, BIM, Salesforce, 
Zoho, Autodesk, SAP Ariba, and Reloy, we are 
collaborating more effectively, automating 
tasks, and making smarter, data-driven 
decisions. This supports cost-effectiveness, 
growth, and a smoother customer journey, 
backed by a three-year digital roadmap.
Key initiatives include immersive VR tours for 
residential and commercial projects to support 
quicker decision-making. The Tenant Portal 
offers residents a unified, self-service platform 
for facility management, service requests, and 
amenity bookings. Complementing these is 
the Pulse App, which curates wellness events 
and community programmes, reinforcing Max 
Estates’ WorkWell and LiveWell philosophies.
Through these digital tools, Max Estates is 
improving leasing speed, tenant satisfaction, 
and brand loyalty, further strengthening 
its premium edge in the Delhi NCR real 
estate market.
Execution at Scale
From a single project, Max Estates has 
evolved into a robust, multi-project portfolio. 
We now manage four operational assets, 
four projects under construction, and 
three in the design phase. Every project 
is running on time and within budget—a 
reflection of our disciplined planning and 
execution strength.
Strategic Partnerships
Collaboration is key to Max Estates’ ability 
to scale with purpose. We actively seek 
long-term partnerships with experts across 
the value chain. Collaborations with design 
leaders such as Gensler and Studio Lotus 
are helping shape sustainable, future-ready 
projects. Our investments in PropTech are 
building smart infrastructure and enhancing 
digital customer engagement.
With a team of nearly 300 professionals and 
a zero-net-debt balance sheet, Max Estates 
is well-positioned to grow with confidence, 
building a portfolio that blends design, 
delivery, and differentiation.

Sustainability and ESG Focus
At Max Estates, we see sustainability 
as a living practice, not a checklist. 
Our approach is guided by the use of 
resources responsibly, improving energy 
efficiency, and creating spaces centred 
around wellbeing.
Sustainable Excellence
Infrastructure plays a significant role in climate change, 
with buildings contributing nearly 40% of global energy use 
and 30% of greenhouse gas emissions. At Max Estates, we 
understand that the spaces we build shape not only how 
people live and work, but also how our planet breathes. We 
are committed to making a positive environmental impact by 
continuously improving resource efficiency and sustainability
For us, sustainability is at the heart of our business. It guides 
how we conserve resources, reduce our carbon footprint, and 
ensure efficiency that makes our business stronger in the 
long run.
Pillars: Sevabhav, Credibility, and Excellence
Our philosophy is guided by Max Group’s core values of Sevabhav, Credibility, and Excellence. These principles 
reflect our ESG commitments and shape our strategy, especially in how we build and how we care for our 
environment, people, and the future.
Our commitment to Sevabhav inspires us to design spaces that give back, where individuals and communities 
are nurtured and included, wellbeing is prioritised, and we are connected to nature. Credibility is our promise 
of openness and trust, rooted in doing what is right in the long run. Excellence drives our pursuit of innovation, 
architectural distinction, and a sustainable design language that is both practical and aesthetically pleasing.

We are working towards clear goals. We want to achieve net zero carbon emissions. Since 2021, our ESG journey 
has been structured, steady, and reflective, helping us learn and refining our ambitions along the way.
Every commercial office we have delivered has secured LEED/

Our upcoming residential offerings, Estate 128 in Noida and

ESG Portfolio
We strengthened our ESG 
performance across the 
organisation, earning a 
GRESB 4-star rating, a notable 
achievement, given our young 
operating history. This places us 
among the leading real estate 
developers in India.
With a clear focus on continuous 
improvement, we are now aiming 
for a 5-star rating in 2025. Since 
initiating our structured ESG 
journey in 2021, we have moved 
through defined short, medium, 
and long-term goals. Having 
delivered on our medium-term 
plans, we took a step back this year 
to recalibrate and raise our ESG 
priorities, aligning them with both 
our business needs and evolving 
global practices.
We also put in place new 
ESG policies, including a new 
Sustainable Sourcing Policy, to 
make sure our growth rests on 
responsibility and ethics. As our 
portfolio diversifies, ESG remains 
definitive to our cause, guiding 
how we design, build, and engage 
with communities, and uphold 
strong governance.
ESG Strategy
In FY2025, we continued to evolve 
and take forward-looking steps that 
not only protected the environment 
but also placed people’s wellbeing 
at the centre of our work.
Design Interventions
We design our buildings to optimise 
environmental performance by 
working in harmony with nature. 
We maximise natural daylight 
in over 50% of occupied spaces 
and have adapted a biophilic 
design, with over 15% of each site 
dedicated to green cover for a 
strong connection to nature. We 
use sound-absorbing materials 
and acoustic strategies, ensuring 
our spaces feel calmer and 
more comfortable as we reduce 
background noise.
Operational Interventions
Wellbeing and safety are key to 
our day-to-day operations. Our 
team carries out comfort surveys 
and health sessions to listen and 
respond to people’s wellbeing 
needs. We have advanced indoor 
air quality systems that use MERV 
13+ grade air and UV filters, with 
real-time tracking of air quality. 
We practice regular emergency 
drills, ongoing checks, and staff 
training so that our spaces remain 
safe and people are prepared for 
any incidents.
Community Interventions
Our ESG ethos believes 
communities thrive when people 
feel included and connected. 
Through our Pulse programme, we 
create spaces that bring people 
together and support work-life 
balance, host events like music 
and film screenings, family days, 
wellness sessions, and cultural 
discussions. Beyond this, we 
contribute through CSR initiatives 
in health, education, and wellbeing. 
On-site, our sports tournaments 
and festivals help us foster a sense 
of belonging and create continuity 
across cultures.
Each of these steps is a part of a 
larger promise. Our ESG roadmap 
is not only about delivering high-
performing spaces, it is about 
shaping spaces that nurture people 
and respect the broader ecosystem 
they live in.
Integrating SDGs into 
Our ESG Strategy
We see UN SDGs as a compass, 
keeping us grounded in what truly 
matters. Our spaces are designed 
to foster wellbeing, sustainability, 
and community upliftment. 
Projects enhance physical and 
emotional wellbeing (SDG 3, 11) 
and foster diversity and safety 
in the workplace (SDG 5, 8). We 
focus on sustainable builds and 
optimum resource use (SDG 6, 9, 
12, 13) by adapting energy-efficient 
systems and promoting climate 
responsibility. Additionally, we 
invest in community education and 
biodiversity (SDG 4, 15), knowing 
that a healthy balance between 
people and planet is what will carry 
us all forward.

Integrated Management Systems 
(IMS)
We embed sustainability into how we work every day 
through globally recognised IMS standards: ISO 9001 
(Quality), ISO 14001 (Environmental), and ISO 45001 
(Occupational Health and Safety). These frameworks 
guide us to act responsibly, with both outcomes and 
processes shaped by care.
ISO 14001 helps us stay mindful of our environmental 
footprint by encouraging energy efficiency, reduced 
waste, conservation of natural resources, and 
thoughtful sourcing. We track our carbon footprint, 
keeping ourselves accountable to both our goals and 
our stakeholders.
ISO 45001 reflects our commitment to health, safety, 
and the wellbeing of our employees. A proactive risk 
management framework and ethical labour practices 
foster a culture where safety comes first, trust is built, 
and community relations are strengthened.
ISO 9001 ensures trust and safety through data 
integrity, strong internal controls, and continuous 
improvement. Standardised processes and clear 
responsibilities drive transparent governance, 
supporting alignment with global ESG reporting 
standards, such as the GRI, and enabling the tracking of 
measurable KPIs.
Strategic Benefits of IMS Implementation:
Strengthened Brand Reputation: Certifications 
reaffirm our commitment to high ESG standards, 
building stakeholder trust.
Investor Confidence: Robust, third-party validated 
systems bring transparency, aligning us with 
sustainable investment mandates.
Operational Efficiency: With one framework, we can 
anticipate risks, manage costs prudently, and deliver 
consistent quality.
Regulatory Compliance: IMS streamlines alignment to 
national and international regulations, helping us stay 
resilient in an evolving landscape.
Risk and Compliance
We uphold a strong commitment to environmental 
compliance and risk mitigation, particularly in 
alignment with evolving regulatory frameworks. 
During FY2025, the Commission for Air Quality 
Management (CAQM) enforced the Graded Response 
Action Plan (GRAP) in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana 
during the winter months to address rising pollution 
levels. In adherence to these directives, Max Estates 
temporarily halted construction activities at select 
sites to prevent environmental degradation. While 
this led to short-term delays in construction timelines, 
it reflected our commitment to sustainable and 
responsible development.
Our sites were also reviewed under the Environment 
(Protection) Act. Every observation was met with care 
and swift action, and we remained fully compliant with 
the applicable legal and environmental standards.
Our key steps to ensure environmental compliance in 
FY2025 included:
	»
Following the conditions set out in Environmental 
Clearance, Consent to Establish, and Consent to 
Operate Certificates.
	»
Submitting required Forms 3, 4, and 5 under the 
Environment (Protection) Act within timelines.
	»
Completed fortnightly e-compliances as required 
by CAQM.
	»
Placed PTZ surveillance cameras at sites to maintain 
complete transparency and compliance with air 
quality measures.
	»
Staying alert to regulatory updates and adopting 
new guidelines shared by CAQM and other 
statutory bodies.
We also invite independent third-party assurance 
audits for energy, water, and waste data. This adds 
credibility to our reporting and reduces environmental 
risks while improving transparency of data. By tracking 
regulations closely, we strengthen our reputation 
as a responsible developer, reduce ecological risks, 
and foster stakeholder trust as we continue our 
ESG journey.
Climate Risk and Scenario Analysis
We recognise that climate change poses real 
challenges to real estate assets. These risks range from 
acute weather events to long-term shifts in climate 
patterns. These changes affect how resilient our assets 
are and how we continue to build confidence among 
our stakeholders.
Physical Climate Risks
We know that climate change is no longer a distant 
concern, it is shaping the way we live and work today. 
Our portfolios are also exposed to climate-related risks, 
including extreme heat, flooding, and erratic rainfall, 
especially in the Delhi NCR region, which, according to 
the State Action Plan on Climate Change (SAPCC), faces 
high vulnerability due to unplanned urbanisation and 
rising temperatures. Looking ahead, climate projections 
for India show a potential 3–5°C rise in temperature 
and a 5–10% increase in monsoon rainfall, elevating the 
risk profile of our physical assets.

Orderly
Net Zero 2050 limits global

costs due to divergent policies 
introduced across sectors, leading 
to a quicker phase out of oil use.

emissions do not decrease until

to limit warming to below 2°C. CO₂ 
removal is limited.

are preserved, leading to high 
physical risks.

assumptions for how climate policy, emissions, and temperatures evolve.

Physical risk
Transition risk
*Risks will be higher in the countries and regions that have stronger policies. For example, in Net Zero 2050, the EU, USA, and Japan 
reach net zero GHGs by 2050, but globally, only net zero CO₂ is reached by this point.
This assessment is based on expert judgement based on how changing this assumption affects key drivers of physical and transition risk. 
For example, higher temperatures are correlated with higher impacts on physical assets and the economy. On the transition risk side, 
assumptions about policy ambition, timing, coordination, and technology policy levers (a) fast technological change even if carbon price 
changes are modest, (b) limited availability of carbon dioxide removal meaning the transition must be more abrupt in other parts of the 
economy, (c) stronger policy in these particular countries and regions.

Transition Risks
Alignment with National and 
Global Climate Goals
Risk Assessment Framework 
at Max Estates
Moving towards a low-carbon economy brings 
shifts in regulatory, technological, and market-
driven risks. These include:
	»
Evolving customer preferences for 
green buildings
	»
Stricter energy efficiency and emissions norms
	»
Capital requirements for retrofitting or 
upgrading technologies
	»
Failure to keep pace with such changes could 
impact property values, restrict financing 
options, and erode the brand’s competitive edge
Max Estates aligns its sustainability strategy with 
India’s Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) 
under the Paris Agreement, aiming to reduce 
emissions, enhance resilience, and contribute 
to global climate goals through sustainable real 
estate development.
Climate risks are integrated into Max Estates’ 
enterprise-wide risk management system:
	»
Risks are mapped across seven frameworks: 
Business, Regulatory, Macroeconomic, People, 
Technology, Brand, and Climate.
	»
Each risk is assessed by scope (portfolio or 
asset-specific), likelihood, and potential impact 
using a 4x4 severity matrix.
	»
Risk severity is categorised  as Low, Moderate, 
Severe, or Critical.
	»
Risk mitigation strategies are actively 
implemented through design resilience, 
green certifications, strategic sourcing, and 
adaptive planning.
By integrating climate scenario analysis and risk mitigation into its operational strategy, Max Estates 
enhances its long-term sustainability, safeguards investor interests, and ensures continued value creation 
in a dynamic environmental landscape.

Sustainability and ESG Focus for FY2026
Key Sustainability Initiatives  for FY2026: 
At Max Estates, sustainability is not a parallel pursuit—it is integral to howwe 
design, build, and deliver spaces. As we advance our ESG journey, FY2026 
marks a strategic inflection point in deepening our climate commitment and 
redefining our sustainability framework to reflect evolving material priorities and 
stakeholder expectations.
Moving forward, the key objective is to map and monitor critical ESG topics, 
enabling us to adapt to sustainability trends and regulations. A significant focus 
for FY2026 is developing a Net Zero Roadmap aligned with the SBTi. Max Estates 
is finalising its Net Zero Policy, which includes formal target setting in accordance 
with SBTi guidelines. The roadmap outlines decarbonisation strategies, including 
enhancing energy efficiency, adopting clean construction practices, and reducing 
embedded carbon to achieve net zero emissions through short-term and 
long-term goal setting.
Through these initiatives, Max Estates aims to become a climate-resilient, future-ready organisation, 
integrating growth with climate action to create a sustainable urban future.

Industry Trends and 
Market Landscape
OPERATING ENVIRONMENT
Max Estates operates in a dynamic real estate environment influenced by 
various macroeconomic, demographic, and technological factors. With a deep 
understanding of these trends and the business needs they create, we have 
positioned ourselves to respond to evolving trends and fresh opportunities, 
particularly in the Delhi NCR region, through a dynamic approach in strategy
Despite global uncertainties, India’s macroeconomic 
landscape showed resilience in 2024, staying on track 
as one of the world’s fastest-growing major economies. 
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) estimated 
a Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth of 6.5%1. 
Strong domestic demand, ongoing infrastructure 
development, and easing inflation supported 
this momentum.
As global uncertainties continue, trade tensions 
and supply chain issues, and the announcement of 
new global tariffs by the United States may impact 
the external sector. The US has introduced a 10%2 
universal tariff on imports. While India has a temporary 
exemption from the additional 26%3, we still face the 
baseline 10% duty on exports.
At home, the Union Budget’s tax incentives could boost 
GDP by 0.6-0.7%. Lower inflation, stable oil prices, and 
reduced borrowing rates are expected to enhance both 
spending and investment.
Looking ahead to FY2026, India’s outlook remains 
steady. Structural reforms, a growing workforce, and 
increased global interest in manufacturing continue to 
support momentum. Inflation is projected to ease to 
4.0%4, while GDP growth is expected to remain steady 
at 6.5%5, as per the Reserve Bank of India (RBI)6.
The Indian real estate sector is poised for significant 
growth. It is projected to reach $1 trillion7 by 2030 
and $7–10 trillion by 2047. Growth is driven by 
expanding infrastructure, rapid urbanisation, a young 
population, a growing manufacturing base, new jobs, 
and a sharper focus on sustainability and technology. 
The sector’s contribution to GDP is expected to stay 
steady at 6–8%. Government policies, such as the Real 
Estate (Regulation and Development) Act (RERA) and 
the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY), add to the 
momentum. The residential market is seeing healthy 
demand across all segments, while strong leasing 
demand supports commercial real estate, led by Global 
Capability Centres (GCCs) that span multiple sectors, 
Max Estates is guided by the belief that people thrive 
when they LiveWell and WorkWell. With this philosophy 
at the core, we are well-positioned for sustainable 
growth in Delhi NCR. We benefit from a strong 
economic environment, a committed team of over 200 
full-time professionals, technology-led operations, and 
a diversified portfolio across residential, commercial, 
and mixed-use segments.
Pre-sales performance has been strong. With Estate 
128 completely sold out and Estate 360 nearing full 
capacity at 96%, we are gearing up for our next chapter 
of growth. To support this, we secured ₹800 crore 
through a Qualified Institutional Placement, along with 
an additional ₹150 crore from preferential allotments 
to promoters and strategic investors.
Our long-term partnership with New York Life 
Insurance Company (NYL) Insurance includes a total 
investment commitment of ₹1,800 crore, with ₹550 
crore earmarked for upcoming projects in Delhi 
One and Sector 105, Noida. As of March 31, 2025, 
Max Estates is net debt-positive with a healthy cash 
surplus of ₹435 crore. This provides the headroom to 
explore fresh opportunities and grow with discipline. 
Favourable urbanisation trends, changing consumer 
preferences and and strong policy support further 
reinforce our outlook. Max Estates is well-equipped to 
navigate macroeconomic uncertainties and continue 
its momentum through FY2026 and beyond.

Rapid Growth and Rising Demand 
for Premium Housing
India’s real estate sector is one of the country’s largest 
employment generators, with over 70 million people 
employed. Its contribution to GDP is expected to rise to 
around 13%8 by 2025, with the market size projected 
to hit $1 trillion by 2030. Institutional investments 
reached $8.9 billion in 2024, up 51%9 from 2023, driven 
by strong capital inflows. Rapid urbanisation is driving 
demand for housing and infrastructure, supported by 
both demand and supply enabling policies. The sector 
is also evolving with green building practices for the 
built environment to enable and not deteriorate better 
quality of life.
Outlook
Max Estates has built a diverse portfolio of over 
17 million square feet across Delhi NCR, covering 
commercial, residential, and mixed-use assets. After 
delivering a series of premium projects in the region, 
we are now focused on accelerating growth through 
carefully selected mixed-use ventures. The plan is to 
add at least 3 million square feet annually, and further 
strengthen our foothold in key micro-markets of 
Delhi NCR.
Office Space Demand and 
Occupier-led Growth
India’s office market hit a record 79 million square 
feet of absorption in 2024, marking a 17%12 year-
on-year increase. This growth was led by domestic 
companies, global entrants, and Global Capability 
Centres, which leased 29 million square feet and are 
expected to continue holding a 35 to 40% share. The 
appeal lies in India’s deep talent pool, tech ecosystem, 
and competitive rentals. Across the board, demand 
is shifting towards green-certified, tech-enabled 
spaces that reflect a growing emphasis on quality and 
sustainability in the post-pandemic world.
Outlook
Max Estates has curated its commercial portfolio to 
deliver premium workspace experiences. Max Square 
was delivered in just 30 months and currently is 
99% leased, at a 30% premium. Its tenants include 
Adobe, NDTV, Cloudangles, and AML Rightsource. Max 
House Phase II, delivered in Q3 FY2024, achieved full 
occupancy within 12 months at a 60% premium. Max 
Towers and Max House Phase I remain fully leased 
at 25–30% above market rates. No tenant holds 
more than 25% of any single asset. Tenant retention 
remains high, with turnover close to zero. This reflects 
the strength, quality, and long-term relevance of 
the portfolio.
Urban Demand Surge
India’s residential real estate market saw strong 
growth in 2024, with housing sales reaching 4.59 
lakh units, 76%10 higher than 2019 levels. Luxury and 
super-luxury homes made up 30% of the new supply, 
rising from just 11% in 2019, while affordable housing 
dropped to 16%11. This shift reflects rising incomes, 
stronger homebuyer confidence, and growing demand 
from affluent buyers, NRIs, and HNIs. The trend is 
likely to continue through FY2026, supported by 
better infrastructure and a growing preference for 
larger homes.
Outlook
Max Estates recorded a landmark year in the residential 
segment in FY2025. Bookings crossed ₹5,300 crore, 
three times higher than FY2024. This underscored the 
strength of our product-market fit. Estate 128 in Noida 
is fully sold, while Phase II achieved a price premium 
of over 40% compared to Phase I. In Gurugram, Estate 
360, Delhi NCR’s first intergenerational residential 
development of its kind, was 96% sold by March 2025. 
Together, these projects contributed ₹980 crore in 
collections. The results reflect Max Estates’ distinct, 
high-quality approach to residential development.
Sustainability and ESG Compliance
Awareness around the environmental impact of the 
built environment is steadily rising. This has led to 
increased regulatory scrutiny and growing investor focus 
on sustainable construction. India now has more than 
60013 IGBC-rated green buildings, most of which deliver 
energy savings of 40–50% and water savings of 30–35%. 
These numbers reflect both widespread adoption and 
sector-wide readiness. GRESB standards are also gaining 
importance, with higher ratings seen as a mark of 
responsible leadership.
Outlook
Rooted in Max Group’s core values of Sevabhav 
(Service), Excellence, and Credibility, and shaped by its 
LiveWell and WorkWell philosophy, Max Estates weaves 
sustainability into every development. The central forest 
courtyard at Max Square, spanning 11,000 square feet, 
and the in-house engagement platform Pulse, which 
hosted over 200 wellbeing events and engaged 8,400 
employees with an Net Promoter Score (NPS) of 6.9 
in FY2025, a very high scale by global standards. This 
shows our on-ground commitment. Since 2021, we have 
held a GRESB 4-star rating, alongside certifications from 
LEED, IGBC, ISO, and WELL. We now aim for a GRESB14 
5-star rating in 2025. Max Estates is also formalising 
its Net Zero targets for Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 
2040 in alignment with SBTi. Scope 3 emissions are 
now being tracked, and Life Cycle Assessments are 
underway across the portfolio. Behind these efforts is 
a combination of strong systems, growing in-house 
expertise, and a passionate team. We are all working 
towards the shared goal of improving lives through 
thoughtfully designed spaces.
Key Trends of India’s Real Estate Sector

Digital Transformation and 
Property Technology
Digitalisation is reshaping every stage of the real 
estate journey, from how properties are discovered 
and built to how they are sold and serviced after 
handover. Real estate firms are increasingly turning 
to PropTech and digital tools to improve everything 
from listings to construction monitoring.
Outlook
Max Estates has adopted digital innovation 
across the business. We use platforms such as 
SAP, BIM, Salesforce, Zoho, Autodesk, FacTech, 
Smart Joules, SAP Ariba, and Reloy to streamline 
workflows, improve collaboration, and support 
faster, more informed decision-making. These 
tools are helping us drive efficiency, reduce 
costs, grow revenues, and offer an enhanced 
customer experience. A structured three-year 
digital roadmap is now in place to further support 
scale readiness. At the same time, Max Estates is 
deploying technology-led solutions to optimise 
energy use, water management, and waste 
handling. These efforts reinforce our commitment 
to sustainable operations.
Policy and Regulatory Reforms
The Real Estate (Regulation and Development) 
Act15 has played a key role in building buyer 
confidence. Surveys and academic studies show its 
positive impact in speeding up dispute resolution 
and reducing unsold inventory by bringing greater 
transparency into the system and disciplined capital 
deployment. For example, in Maharashtra, RERA 
now issues user-friendly registration certificates that 
clearly outline project details and require developers 
to share regular progress updates with homebuyers.
Outlook
Max Estates takes great pride in meeting the highest 
standards set by RERA and all other applicable laws 
including building bye-laws, environment-related 
compliances and labour-related best practices. 
This compliance reflects our commitment to 
maintaining the highest standards of integrity, 
transparency, and professional excellence. By 
ensuring clear, timely communication throughout 
every stage of the property journey, Max Estates 
creates an environment where customers feel 
valued and confident in their decisions.
Looking Ahead
As India’s real estate sector evolves, growing demand 
for premium experiences, regulatory transparency, and 
sustainable infrastructure continues to shape the market. 
Max Estates continues to stand out by creating integrated 
spaces that are thoughtfully designed and future-ready. 
Every project is guided by our “One Region, Multiple 
Asset Classes” strategy and our LiveWell and WorkWell 
philosophy, both of which place wellness, efficiency, and 
design at the forefront. We aim to become Delhi NCR’s 
leading real estate brand.
In FY2026, Max Estates will focus on scaling pre-sales to 
₹6,000–6,500 crore, securing 2,00,000 square feet of 
pre-leased space and adding 3 million square feet of new 
opportunities. Timely, on-budget execution remains a 
top priority. Our key priorities include financial closures, 
securing a GRESB 5-star rating, expanding digital systems, 
enhancing risk management and talent development, and 
expanding our brand footprint beyond Delhi NCR.

Materiality at the Core: 
Shaping Sustainable Growth
MATERIALITY
Max Estates’ materiality assessment involved an internal desk review benchmarking 
best practices from industry peers, covering environmental, social, and governance 
pillars. Our review identified priority topics—ranging from Climate Change and 
Governance to Energy Management, Employee Development and Engagement, and 
Customer Health and Safety—each mapped to specific KPIs, such as GHG emissions, 
energy savings, training hours, and CSAT scores.
Moving forward, we intend to integrate these material topics into our strategic 
planning, establish science-based targets, and implement robust governance 
structures to ensure accountability. We will monitor progress through regular data 
collection and audits, leveraging sustainability committees for ongoing oversight and 
continuous improvement. This approach, grounded in peer-led best practices, will 
enhance transparency, stakeholder engagement, and long-term value creation.

Delivering Long-term Value
At Max Estates, we remain steadfast in our commitment to creating sustainable, long-term shareholder value 
through careful capital allocation and thoughtful land acquisitions. In FY2025, we exceeded financial forecasts 
and diversified our income, supporting stability while opening new opportunities for growth.
Strengthening Financial Resilience and Efficiency
We believe resilience comes from using our resources wisely; hence, this year, we optimised costs 
and enhanced margins, while adapting targeted measures in our key expense areas.
Through these initiatives, along with careful project budget tracking, we 
achieved a big turnaround: recording a Profit Before Tax of ₹37.61 crore instead 
of the earlier year loss of ₹23.29 crore. We reviewed budgets against actual 
performance reviews every quarter. Each month, we also keep a close eye on our 
operational costs, with any major deviations escalated to senior leadership for 
governance and control.
Our effective tax rate for FY2025 was about 30%. We remain committed to both 
compliance and thoughtful tax management.
We aim to scale our leasing income and expand residential bookings, with a 
target ₹6,000–6,500 crore in FY2026. We continue to prioritise capital-efficient 
growth. This combination of operational excellence and disciplined financial 
management gives us confidence to meet our vision of creating lasting value for 
our shareholders.
In FY2025 Max Estates enhanced operational efficiency and financial discipline: 
The strong performance was driven by increased leasing and interest income from surplus funds,

Strategic Stewardship of Capital
FY2025 was a turning point for us, as we deployed capital to strengthen our pipeline, expand our portfolio, and 
enhance financial flexibility, all while maintaining a strong balance sheet.
To fuel our next phase of growth, we raised over ₹1,300 crore  through a combination of Qualified Institutional 
Placement (QIP) and preferential allotments, as well as increased investments from our long-standing partner, 
New York Life Insurance Company (NYL). This capital infusion is a quiet vote of confidence from domestic and 
global institutional investors in our plan and people. This gives us breathing room to build thoughtfully and 
continue on our path of bringing our long-term vision to life. 
Pre-sales Growth: 
Unlocking Momentum
FY2025 was a breakthrough year for us, with strong pre-
sales performance that went beyond our guidance and 
underscored the market’s confidence in who we are, what we 
create and how we deliver.
This was driven by the successful launches of Estate 360 in Gurugram, contributing over ₹4,400 crore with 
92% inventory sold, and Estate 128 Phase II in Noida, achieving a 100% sell-out with ₹900 crore in bookings. 
Together, these projects collected ₹980 crore.
Looking ahead, we aim for pre-sales of ₹6,000–6,500 crore in FY2026 and cumulative bookings of over 
₹21,000 crore across FY2026-28. Led by our sharp market insights and a deep commitment to our customers, 
we will continue to achieve product-market fit and elevate everyday experiences for our customers.
Max Estates continues to prioritise capital-efficient models, such as JDAs, to scale its residential portfolio while 
resulting in less upfront cash outflow. By doing so, we enhanced our ability to de-risk projects, align cash flows 
with sales cycles, and create steady, consistent returns.
Every cent matters, so we ensure 
effective capital allocation and tight 
cost management. We treat our 
administrative budgets with care and 
plan them each year using a zero-based 
approach. We compare it with our past 
performances, and review our growth 
every quarter. We track our cost in real 
time, renegotiate with our vendors, and 
apply value engineering to mitigate 
inflationary pressures, especially in 
construction materials. For pricing and 
pre-sales strategies, we lean on detailed 
unit-level profitability analysis and respond 
to the changing rhythms of the market. This 
balanced approach allows us to keep cash 
flows steady and dependable, giving our 
stakeholders peace of mind.

Circular Capital, Continuous Growth
Our cash flow practices are in place to effectively 
navigate business cycles, and the ups and downs of

we maintain cost discipline, which has helped us 
reach where we are today.
	»
We believe true growth comes with sustainability. 
We are aiming for top green building certifications

	»

against single-use plastics and in total support for

programmes like Pulse. These initiatives are bringing 
us closer to our Net Zero goal.
	»
This strategy, centred on capital recycling, cost

helps us grow steadily and responsibly, while

With these acquisitions, we have grown our portfolio

Land acquisition for us is not about the pace but 
about doing it right. Our proactive, cross-functional 
approach ensures Legal, Finance, Design, and Liaison 
teams work hand in hand to ensure approvals are 
seamless and due diligence is thorough. We also 
work alongside the authorities and involve external 
consultants early to facilitate swift clearances, such

steady, ready and prepared. 
Our agile yet disciplined land acquisition strategy

shaped around people’s needs and well-being.

Artistic Rendition
We at Max Estates follow a disciplined capital 
recycling programme that balances growth 
with financial flexibility across our portfolio. 
We systematically release capital from fully 
leased commercial assets through Lease Rental 
Discounting (LRD), which allows us to redeploy 
funds into new high-yield residential and 
commercial projects. Step by step, we are building a 
high-quality commercial portfolio with the potential 
for a Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) listing in 
the future. This will open opportunities for creating 
long-term value and steady growth. 
We follow a disciplined approach to land acquisition, central to our long-term strategy of adding 3 million 
square feet annually, with 2 million square feet in residential developments and 1 million square feet in 
commercial developments. All our land acquisitions are made using equity capital, so we grow without the 
weight of debt, ensure financial prudence and maintain a resilient balance sheet.
In FY2025, we moved with pace by securing key land parcels and development rights in high-demand micro-
markets throughout the Delhi-NCR region. These were fully funded through equity raised via QIP, preferential 
allotments, and targeted asset monetisation. This reinforces our commitment to capital efficiency and the 
timely delivery of projects.

Internal Control Systems and Compliance
We at Max Estates maintain a strong internal control and an efficient financial reporting framework. 
This has helped us protect our accuracy, integrity, and clarity of our financial information. Anchored in 
governance and discipline, we ensure compliance with regulatory standards and our strategic goals.
We have built a strong Internal Control Framework to guide our business practices:
Future Roadmap for Steady Value Creation
We aim to become a leading real estate brand in the Delhi-NCR region, known for thoughtful design that cares 
and a hospitality approach that is people-first. Our WorkWell and LiveWell philosophies guide our steps as we 
strengthen capabilities across our real estate journey. Our growth plan focuses on scalability, efficiency, and 
institutional-grade governance.
Our long-term strategy is driven by an asset-light, JV-heavy model, which ensures capital-efficient growth 
while maintaining a strong balance sheet and a steady cash flow. Strategic partnerships, including the 49% 
co-investment from New York Life in our commercial portfolio, help bring this to life. To minimise execution 
risk and enhance operational agility, we are deepening investments in digital transformation, automation, and 
system upgrades.

Our Finance team is grounded in 
accounting standards, tax regulations, and 
evolving regulatory guidelines through 
ongoing training, process updates, and 
close collaborations with trusted external 
advisors. Financial transparency is central to

has helped us earn confidence, proactively

for all our stakeholders.
Technology Backbone
SAP S/4HANA ERP with real-time

and user access controls for improved 
process efficiency and data accuracy.
