Cross-functional teams drive cost efficiency 
through value engineering, bulk procurement, 
structured budget reviews, and Cost Reduction 
Opportunity Registers. We also maintain 
margins without compromising on our quality.
Compliance and Transparency
Compliance with Ind AS, SEBI LODR, taxation, 
and corporate governance norms. Related-party 
transactions are disclosed transparently, reviewed by 
the Audit Committees, both internal and external.
Financial Forecasting and Planning
Driver-based forecasting and rolling projections keep 
our planning agile. Annual budgets are bottom-up, 
validated by benchmarking, and regularly updated to 
meet changing market conditions.
Financial Discipline
All financial reporting is aligned with Ind 
AS and regulatory guidelines, backed by a 
maker-checker-approver system, multi-factor 
authentication, and documented SOPs to 
maintain compliance.
Robust MIS and Monitoring
Monthly MIS reviews and quarterly financial 
true-ups that keep operational performance 
in line with our financial targets. Our Finance 
team closely collaborates with project teams 
to monitor costs, assess risks, and take timely 
corrective action when needed.
Scenario Planning and Risk Mitigation
Regular analyses to identify risks such as cost 
escalations, liquidity pressures, and regulatory 
changes. Mitigation plans are developed with 
the help of experts at our Finance, Projects, 
and Procurement teams.
This roadmap reflects our commitment to grow responsibly and deliver profitably, while maintaining 
financial discipline with long-term, sustainable value for all our stakeholders.

Our diverse portfolio spans residential, commercial,

Our Portfolio at a Glance
Commercial Projects
Max Towers, Noida
Located at the edge of South Delhi in Noida, Max 
Towers is a 0.6 million square foot commercial 
development designed to set new standards for 
workspaces. The building holds LEED Platinum 
certification for Green Building strategies and 
Operations & Maintenance, IGBC Platinum-rated 
for Health and Wellness, and WELL-certified for 
Health and Safety. It has an in-house auditorium, 
lively F&B spaces, an early learning centre, 
a 374-seater cafeteria, and sports zones, all 
brought to life with biophilia and art.
Max Square, Noida
Conceived from the image of a folded hand 
protecting a growing bud, Max Square brings 
the idea of nature and nurture to life. Spanning 
about 0.7 million square feet, it offers unique 
office spaces centred around an 11,000 
square feet forest. Situated in Sector 129 
along the Noida-Greater Noida Expressway, 
one of Delhi NCR’s fastest-growing micro-
markets, Max Square is IGBC Platinum-rated 
for Green Building strategies, IGBC-rated for 
Health and Wellness, and WELL-certified for 
Health and Safety.
Max House Phase 1 & 2, Delhi
Situated in the heart of South Delhi, Max 
House draws inspiration from its industrial 
surroundings and reinterprets them for a 
modern workforce. Spanning about 0.25 
million square feet, it is LEED Gold-certified 
for Green Building strategies, IGBC Gold-rated 
for Health and Wellness, and WELL-certified 
for Health and Safety. A dedicated amenities 
block hosts EatWell by Diva, event spaces, a 
business centre, and multiple collaborative 
zones designed to encourage connection, 
creativity, and community.
Every new development expands our geographical 
footprint and redefines urban living with a focus on 
well-being, sustainability, and community. Below are 
our landmark projects that reflect our thoughtful 
design and people-first approach to real estate.
This year, the Company advanced its mixed-use 
development strategy through major acquisitions in 
the Delhi-NCR region, enhancing its innovative real 
estate vision. Working closely across teams and with 
external experts, we navigated land and regulatory 
requirements to keep our plans on track. Our portfolio 
now stands at 17 million square feet, with a clear 
goal to add at least 3 million square feet a year across 
residential and commercial spaces.

MAX ESTATES LIMITED
Residential Projects
Estate 128, Noida
Located in Sector 128, Noida, Estate 128 is 
thoughtfully designed with contemporary 
architecture and a focus on resident well-being. 
Spread across 10 acres with approximately 1.4 
million square feet of development, it is IGBC 
Platinum pre-certified. The residences feature 
expansive decks for bespoke outdoor experiences 
and amenities that encourage movement, 
connection, and interaction. With over 80% open 
spaces in the midst of a bustling city, it offers a 
calm, open environment for residents.
Estate 360, Gurugram
In Sector 36A, Gurugram, along the Dwarka 
Expressway, Estate 360 takes a unique 
approach to community living. One that 
honours every need and every generation. 
It is IGBC Platinum pre-certified and spread 
over 11.8 acres, with about 2.4 million square 
feet of development potential. Designed as 
an “intergenerational residential community,” 
with two of its six residences dedicated to 
senior living, it is managed by Antara, India’s 
only integrated senior care ecosystem. It 
houses an ecosystem of over 1,00,000 square 
feet of amenities, featuring two clubhouses, 
a sports block, and a car-free ground plaza 
designed for safety and reduced pollution.
222 Rajpur, Dehradun
Set beside the Malsi forest at one of 
Dehradun’s most exclusive addresses, 222 
Rajpur offers a limited collection of 22 villas. 
Spread across 5 acres, it is designed for 
homeowners who value privacy and a life of 
peace in the lap of nature. 
Delhi One Redevelopment, Noida
We acquired the Delhi One Redevelopment project 
after receiving final approvals under the Insolvency 
& Bankruptcy Code from Hon’ble NCLT and Hon’ble 
NCLAT. Spanning approximately 2.5 million square 
feet, Delhi One will be an integrated downtown 
campus. It will host ultra-luxury serviced residences, 
premium office space, curated high-street retail 
and an exclusive club, all guided by our LiveWell, 
WorkWell and PlayWell approach. Located at the 
edge of South Delhi and connected by the Delhi-
Noida-Direct Flyway, the site is also steps from key 
metro stations, offering strong connectivity across 
Delhi NCR. We expect total sales of approximately 
I2,000 crore, with annuity rental income potential of 
around I120 crore.
Max Square Two
We are expanding the Max Square campus with 
Max Square Two, next to the existing building. The 
project sits on approximately 4 acres and is IGBC 
Platinum pre-certified. It will provide a balanced 
mix of commercial space and amenities, spanning 
about 1.1 million square feet. The expanded campus 
will give existing tenants room to grow and create a 
distinctive campus destination in the micro-market. 
Planned with a focus on enhancing the workplace 
experience, the campus will feature a suite of 
amenities including business centres, multipurpose 
halls, F&B spaces, a creche, and more.

Max District, Gurugram
Inspired by the charm of a walled city, Max District 
blends structure and nature, with gardens flowing 
seamlessly from the outdoors into the heart of the 
space. Spanning approximately 1.6 million square 
feet, it sits on Golf Course Extension Road, a prime 
hub for domestic and multinational businesses in 
Delhi NCR. Pre-certified for LEED Platinum, this 
modern workspace combines sustainability with a 
wide range of amenities, including F&B spaces, gyms, 
and wellness facilities, creating an environment 
where work, well-being, and lifestyle come together.
Sector 105, Noida
In Sector 105, Noida, we are developing a mixed-use 
destination across 10 acres with about 2.6 million 
square feet of potential, split into 40% residential and 
60% commercial space. With three open sides and a 
striking 75-meter frontage along the Noida-Greater 
Noida Expressway, the site enjoys strong visibility and 
connectivity. Set within a vibrant micro-market, it will 
embody our LiveWell and WorkWell philosophies, 
bringing fitness, sports, and active living into a 
thoughtfully curated urban setting.
Estate 361, Gurugram
We are expanding in Gurugram with Estate 361 on 
the Dwarka Expressway. Spread over approximately 
18 acres, it has about 4 million square feet of 
development potential. The scheme is being planned 
around our LiveWell philosophy, with design choices 
that aim to bring real well-being to everyday living.

Diverse Spaces that Elevate Living
Efficient Operations, Transforming Experiences
FY2025 was a milestone year of growth for us, 
reaffirming our confidence in the real estate potential 
of the Delhi-NCR region. Staying true to our core 
philosophies of WorkWell and LiveWell philosophies, 
we expanded our development portfolio from 8 million 
square feet in FY2024 to more than 17 million square 
feet in FY2025, covering residential, commercial, and 
mixed-use segments.
Between Estate 128 and 
Estate 360, we achieved 
₹980 crore in collections.
Our portfolio now features a diverse mix of asset classes 
across Delhi-NCR, with projects at various stages 
including delivered, under construction, and under 
design. We focus on creating design-led, hospitality-
driven spaces that address a gap in the market for truly 
consumer-centric developments. 
We also cap any single tenant’s occupancy at 25% of a 
building. This approach reduces dependency risk and 
strengthens tenant retention, reflecting the appeal of 
our spaces and strong tenant relationships.
Modular Construction Pilot
We are driving construction excellence through a 
modular and off-site strategy that delivers speed, 
precision, and sustainability. We prefabricate temporary 
structures and formwork off-site, which minimises 
material waste and reduces on-site disruption. Our fully 
unitised façades are manufactured and assembled with 
a high level of quality control, while aluminium modular 
formwork shortens slab cycle times significantly.
We plan every step in advance and maintain a two-
month material buffer to stay ahead of potential delays. 
On-site batching plants ensure a steady concrete supply, 
and our equipment is regularly calibrated for consistency. 
Modular techniques give us greater design flexibility, 
support ergonomic handling, and enhance worker safety.
Before adopting any new material, we conduct thorough 
case studies and due diligence. This disciplined approach 
reflects our commitment to quality, efficiency, and 
innovation in every build.
We run our operations with a singular focus: delivering 
high-performing assets and exceptional tenant 
experiences. Our collaborative approach combines 
technology, hospitality, and sustainability, with each 
property managed by a dedicated on-site team 
supported by top consultants. Daily monitoring and 
maintenance keep us on budget and on point.
Tenant onboarding is designed for speed and ease, with 
inspections, coordination with tenant project teams, 
and a structured handover process guided by detailed 
checklists and fit-out protocols. Post-handover, the 
FacTech complaint management system enables quick 
resolution of concerns through close collaboration 
between our CRM, Operations, and Projects teams.
At 222 Rajpur, the townhouses and villas have been 
handed over, while apartment handovers at Estate 
128 and Estate 360 are upcoming. We also work 
with trusted external partners to curate wellness 
services, dining options, and cultural programmes, 
Smart Design
We put smart, innovative design at the centre of how 
we create spaces, by blending aesthetics, functionality, 
and financial discipline. In FY2025, we launched 
programmes to test new fittings, finishes, and 
modular components, combining design appeal with 
cost efficiency.
At Estate 128, we used a step-by-step prototyping 
process, starting with material samples and moving to 
miniature mock-ups, then to a full apartment mock-up 
before final finishing. On-site, we created 1:1 scale flex 
layout mock-ups to test room sizes and configurations 
physically. We also used VR tools for immersive layout 
reviews and upgraded our 3D software to speed up 
design iterations and refine prototypes.
We follow a structured, cross-functional value 
engineering process from concept to execution, making 
sure every premium design choice aligns with cost 
efficiency and our brand standards.
	»
Collaborative Ideation: Early-stage workshops bring 
together design, execution, procurement, and finance 
teams to identify cost drivers and optimise them 
without compromising the experience.
	»
Material and Systems Optimisation: We replace 
high-cost elements with durable, locally sourced 
alternatives, especially for façades, HVAC, flooring, and 
common areas.
	»
Mock-Up Validation: Every design is tested 
through full-scale mock-ups to ensure the customer 
experience is never compromised.
	»
Lifecycle Thinking: We assess every choice for long-
term operational and maintenance efficiency.
	»
Tech-Enabled Precision: Tools like BIM, SAP, and 
data analytics guide benchmarking, efficiency, and 
waste reduction.
	»
Strategic Cost Alignment: Partnerships and vendor 
collaboration help unlock design innovations, supply 
chain efficiencies, and enhanced value delivery.
By building intelligence and efficiency into every 
element, we are creating spaces that are beautiful, 
functional, smart, and ready for the future.
while internal meetings and strategy sessions aim to 
enhance operational value, such as improving visitor 
parking services.
Key features of Max Estates’ operational approach:
	»

internal trackers

help desks for efficient service delivery

This model allows Max Estates to scale with precision,

customer-centric approach.

Quality Management 
and Assurance
Quality is embedded into every stage of the 
Company’s development and operations. 
Max Estates adopts a proactive, structured 
approach that integrates compliance, 
safety, and performance across its portfolio. 
Compliance with the National Building 
Code (NBC, 2005 & 2016) and certifications 
such as ISO 9001 (Quality Management), 
ISO 14001 (Environmental Management), 
and ISO 45001 (Occupational Health and 
Safety) underpin its project execution and 
asset operations.
Third-party audits, including monthly 
reviews by Bureau Veritas, ensure 
compliance with national standards. 
Façades and temporary structures are 
built off-site for precision and reduced 
waste. Teams are trained on updated 
safety protocols, and contractors work 
under strict compliance norms. Utility 
performance is monitored via IoT sensors 
and dashboards, optimising energy, water, 
and HVAC systems while minimising 
emissions. Energy-efficient technologies, 
such as rooftop solar panels and rainwater 
harvesting, enhance sustainability and 
asset value.
Regular disaster recovery drills, backed 
by documented findings and audit 
validations, strengthen resilience and 
ensure operational continuity across 
every property.

adoption of energy-efficient systems. Initiatives 
such as:
	»
IoT-enabled HVAC and lighting systems
	»
Solar power and green energy purchases
	»
Reuse of treated wastewater and rainwater
	»
Material recycling and e-waste resale
	»
Design in line with IGBC/LEED standards for reduced 
utility and maintenance costs
Annual budgeting, strategic vendor negotiations, and 
proactive asset upgrades help us reduce operational 
costs. Through continuous innovation and disciplined 
governance, we create long-term value while staying 
agile in a dynamic environment.

Innovation that facilitates 
Care-led Growth - LiveWell 
and WorkWell Framework
Innovation at Max Estates begins with people. We 
design spaces that prioritise care, elevate quality of life, 
and nurture a sense of belonging. Growth is guided by 
the LiveWell and WorkWell frameworks, which shape 
how people live, work, and connect within our spaces. 
These frameworks combine wellness, sustainability, 
and digital capability to meet holistic expectations 
across physical, emotional, and social needs.
We design spaces with a wellness-led approach, think 
wrap-around balconies that bring daylight and fresh 
air to homes or a 10,000 square feet forest courtyard 
at Max Square. We use basement cutouts to bring 
natural light to lower levels, and landscapes with native, 
air‑purifying plants to support cleaner and healthier 
living. Amenities including yoga studios, fitness centres, 
and spas help people nurture well-being everyday.
Our delivery backbone is guided by LiveWell and 
WorkWell checklists that help us stay aligned with 
our vision, while BIM and SAP provide real-time 
coordination, quality control, and a consistent, 
customer-focused experience.
Our approach rests on nine steadfast pillars that 
hold our customer-centric innovation model:
Backed by advanced digital platforms and real-time 
feedback, our multidisciplinary team of specialists 
spans real estate, design, operations, and hospitality. 
They work together to ensure every development 
consistently meets high standards of performance 
and experience.
Pulse
At Max Estates, we believe that spaces truly come 
alive when they create moments that matter. Our 
in-house engagement platform, Pulse, brings 
this vision to life by curating a rich mix of events, 
activities, and interactions that nurture community 
spirit, support wellbeing, and deepen the bond 
between people and the places they call home.
In FY2025, Pulse hosted over 
200 events, engaging more than 
8,400 tenant employees and 
reinforcing our commitment to 
building communities where 
people can flourish.
Guided by a care-led and philosophy-driven 
approach, we are shaping a fresh vision for 
urban living and working in India. We transform 
empathy, insight, and thoughtful design into 
lasting value for both our users and stakeholders. 
Pulse carries forward our WorkWell principle, 
cultivating healthier and more connected 
communities with environments full of energy 
and life as our portfolio expands.
Leveraging Technology in 
Real Estate
Digital innovation sits at the core of how we build, 
manage, and grow our portfolio. In FY2025, we rolled 
out a detailed digital transformation across every 
function of the organisation, enabling smarter decisions, 
seamless collaboration, and greater efficiency across 
our ecosystem.
From construction sites and compliance checks to 
customer experience and employee engagement, every 
stakeholder is positively impacted by our thoughtful, 
human-centric digital strategy.
The customer journey is streamlined 
and enriched, through tools like 
Salesforce, Ozontel, Reloy, FacTech, 
and SAP that make every customer 
interaction personal and efficient. 
For our vendors, SAP and SAP 
Ariba support a fully automated 
procurement and payment process 
that is transparent, responsive, and 
cost-conscious, helping people in our 
ecosystem work smarter.
We use Zoho HRMS to simplify the employee lifecycle 
from onboarding to career growth, while TeamLease 
handles compliance digitally to reduce friction and 
make it seamless. In construction, platforms such as 
Autodesk Construction Cloud and SAP Analytics Cloud 
let us track projects in real time, manage resources 
efficiently and control budgets. With an integrated 
technology stack, including SAP S/4HANA, Salesforce, 
SharePoint, and Factech BMS, we safeguard data integrity, 
support cross-functional alignment, and strengthen 
operational performance.
A co-creative, agile approach shapes every innovation. 
We partner with OEMs, start-ups, and digital partners 
to design solutions tailored for real estate. These 
advancements are protected by strong cybersecurity 
and secure VPN access. By embedding technology into 
every department across construction, operations and 
administration, we enhance efficiency, create lasting value 
and better experiences for everyone.

Design and Research
Max Estates’ design philosophy is rooted in its 
thoughtful research, user insights, and global best 
practices. Our Design and Product team utilises 
a structured, insight-led approach that lends 
functionality with warmth, creating contemporary 
urban spaces that are relevant and distinctive.
Ideas take shape through a blend of internal exploration 
and collaborations. We combine competitive 
benchmarking, trend studies, and partnerships with 
international consultants and research experts. The 
evolving needs of our customers are understood 
through open conversations, focus groups, expert 
exchanges and prototype trials with potential 
buyers, ensuring each design reflects both aspiration 
and practicality.
From the first sketch to detailed 3D models, every 
project moves through a well-structured design 
journey. Layouts are refined with Sales, Leasing, and 
Finance teams to balance creativity with commercial 
sense. This open, cross-functional approach helps 
create spaces that are cohesive, purposeful, and long-
lasting. To bring fresh perspective and craftsmanship, 
we work alongside global design leaders such 
as Gensler UK, Studio Lotus, and RSP, blending 
international inspiration with a deep understanding 
of local character to shape spaces that are distinctive, 
sustainable, and human in spirit.

Operational Agility: Delivering 
Differentiation
At Max Estates, operational agility is guided by 
the goal of creating exceptional experiences. It is 
supported by well-structured systems, seamless digital 
integration, and a culture of continual improvement. 
We focus on balancing high performance with costs 
efficiently, never losing sight of long-term value across 
our operations. Through advanced platforms, lean 
processes, and real-time insights, agility is woven into 
every fabric of how we think, design, and deliver.
We also bring consistency and efficiency to every site 
through our Integrated Management System (IMS) that 
follows ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and ISO 45001 standards. 
These help us strengthen performance, streamline 
processes, and reinforce safety and sustainability. Our 
teams rely on digital tools like the Vendor Management 
System (VMS) and trackers such as Excel and 
Google Sheets to simplify administrative work. Real-
time dashboards, SOPs, and performance KPIs are 
embedded into daily practices, allowing for transparent 
tracking and timely course corrections.
Key operational enhancements include:
	»
SAP implementation for a streamlined inventory, 
operations, finance, CAM, and CAPEX management, 
which fast-tracks approvals and improves visibility.
	»
Factech App adoption for field technicians, providing 
real-time task updates, swift complaint resolution, 
and seamless coordination across developments.
	»
Predictive Maintenance programmes using vibration 
analysis, thermography, and oil diagnostics to shift 
from scheduled to condition-based servicing that 
minimises downtime and maximises asset life.
	»
Digital energy monitoring and HVAC optimisation 
through IoT sensors and BMS platforms, assisting 
in proactive energy management and greater 
cost efficiency.
	»
Neptune and other smart tech tools, vendor 
management systems, and automated trackers 
are used to simplify workflows and reduce 
manual interventions.
We balance short-term cost controls with long-term 
investments. We use phased capital planning and ROI-
based initiatives such as Cooling-as-a-Service (CaaS) 
and partnerships with OEMs to shrink lifecycle costs. 
Our IT framework remains flexible, steered by a well-
defined skill matrix, continuous learning, agile practices 
and regular feedback to nurture a scalable, future-
ready, people-first roadmap.

Data Privacy: Bolstering 
Digital Security
In FY2025, we strengthened our cybersecurity 
and privacy frameworks through proactive, 
organisation-wide interventions. Data masking 
and access controls were built in CRM applications 
to protect sensitive information. These were 
supported by multi-factor authentication, audit 
trails, and a maker-checker-approver process. We 
also completed a detailed Vulnerability Assessment 
and Penetration Testing (VAPT) exercise, addressing 
all issues flagged. We are also countering data 
breaches and cyber threats through the use of 
Data Loss Prevention (DLP) systems, securing email 
gateways, and encrypting protocols.
All vendor interactions are guided by NDAs, 
with clear Turnaround Time (TAT) protocols that 
respond to the severity of incidents. Governance 
over software usage is maintained through the 
centralised license management system and 
monthly compliance. Our IT operations follow 
the ITIL framework for risk management, change 
control, and incident response. When it comes to 
new tech initiatives, we are using the Eisenhower 
Matrix to set priorities and balance urgency for 
smoother project executions.
Our commitment to continuous improvement is 
reflected in regular application updates, annual 
security reviews, and strategic partnerships. 
Together, these efforts help us remain secure, 
accountable, and well-prepared for the future.

Compliance
Max Estates works within an extensive compliance and 
intensive control framework supported by advanced 
digital systems and ethical governance. Our enterprise 
resource planning platform, SAP, provides financial 
accuracy, control, and regulatory discipline through 
safeguards such as segregation of duties, documented 
SOPs, system-led checks, monthly reconciliations, and 
multi-level management reviews. These steps preserve 
integrity and reliable data.
For auditable, and accessible recordkeeping, we 
maintain a secure Document Management System 
(DMS) fortified by an automated backup policy in line 
with the regulatory standards. This protects us against 
data loss and strengthens business continuity.
Max Estates uses digital tools such as 
Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC), 
Microsoft Project (MSP), and SAP, to 
enhance project planning, progress 
monitoring, and risk mitigation.
These tools provide us with real-time dashboards 
that simplify reporting, and encourage transparency 
across functions. All financial reporting is compliant 
with Ind AS and other statutory norms. It is supported 
by continuous training for our finance teams 
and strengthened through periodic internal and 
external audits.
Long-term Digital Roadmap
In collaboration with KPMG, we have mapped out a 
comprehensive three-year digital plan that will steer 
us towards our growth ambitions while deepening our 
people-first commitment, operational excellence, and 
sustainability goals. The roadmap aligns with our teams 
with global business practices, making us future-ready 
and KPI-driven.
In FY2026 and beyond, our digital transformation 
efforts will focus on:
	»
Expanding automation across financial workflows, 
improving SAP capabilities, and advancing analytics 
to foster decision-making and business agility.
	»
Scaling technology adoption across the real estate 
value chain, in both commercial and residential 
assets, to elevate health, safety, customer experience, 
operational efficiency, and cost management.
	»
Embedding ESG principles across our portfolio as we 
work towards achieving a 5-star GRESB rating while 
integrating renewable energy solutions and setting 
sharp Net Zero targets.
	»
Broadening brand presence and customer 
engagement by communicating Max Estates 
narrative across Delhi-NCR and select international 
markets, expanding both our reach and 
customer base.
This roadmap positions Max Estates to lead with 
intelligent digital integration, sustainable practices, and 
to create long-term value that stands the test of time 
for all our stakeholders.

Performance and 
Career Development
We nurture a performance culture that is transparent, 
structured, and closely tied to business outcomes 
and individual growth. In FY2024, we introduced 
the Performance Enhancement Plan (PEP), further 
strengthened in FY2025, which now anchors our 
biannual review cycle during October-November and 
April-May. This ensures every employee receives timely, 
constructive feedback.
Evaluations are linked to clearly defined Key 
Responsibility Areas (KRAs) and competency parameters 
shared in advance. 
Performance reviews are anchored 
in Measures of Success (MoS), a 
framework aligned with business 
goals and approved by the NRC and 
Board, ensuring every individual’s 
growth is in step with Max Estates’ 
strategic priorities.
Learning and 
Development Framework
A future-focused approach to 
capability-building sits at the core 
of our talent strategy. Each year, 
Max Estates allocate a dedicated 
Learning and Development 
(L&D) budget, shaped by past 
year’s utilisation and projected 
headcount. Following the annual 
review cycle in May, we conduct 
a Training Needs Analysis (TNA) 
that informs tailored Individual 
Development Plans (IDPs) for 
every employee.
Created in consultation with 
managers, each IDP outlines 
targeted learning programmes 
aligned with personal aspirations 
and business priorities. Progress 
is reviewed at both mid-year and 
annual assessments. A dedicated 
L&D budget is allotted at the 
beginning of the year ensuring 
organisation-wide and individual 
learning needs are catered to. This 
ensures that employees are able to 
pursue skill-building programmes,

Empowering Through Expertise – 
Employee Training and Development
At Max Estates, exceptional performance starts with preparation and 
thrives on continuous learning, anchored by Max Asset Services Limited 
(MASL). Our approach is structured, inclusive, and aligned with both 
departmental goals and real-time skill needs. The Annual Training Plan 
promotes both organisational and personal growth, while the Train-the-
Trainer (TtT) programme equips in-house trainers to lead high-quality 
sessions in engineering, housekeeping, and security.
To determine training priorities, we utilise a Training Needs Identification 
(TNI) system that employs a blended learning approach. From classroom 
instruction and digital modules to hands-on practice, the effectiveness 
is measured through assessments and feedback. Upon completing the 
training, participants receive certificates and tokens of appreciation, 
which help foster a positive learning environment.
All our employees are required to complete human rights training, 
covering the Max Code of Conduct and the Prevention of Sexual 
Harassment (POSH) policies, reinforcing our commitment to a zero-
tolerance approach to violations. Emergency drills, safety campaigns, and 
knowledge-sharing sessions further strengthen readiness and resilience.
We have partnered with the globally recognised British Safety Council 
(BSC) to strengthen our health, safety, and sustainability standards. 
Through BSC’s digital learning platform, our employees gain access 
to comprehensive training, assessments, and resources, ensuring our 
workplaces remain safe, healthy, and future-ready.
In FY2026, Max Estates will launch a digital learning platform to make 
training more accessible, trackable, and impactful. Compliance training 
for every new hire will be mandatory, with digital modules and integrated 
assessments ensuring complete readiness from day one.
Through our Organizatson Talent Review 
(OTR), we pair competency assessments 
with in-depth Training Needs Analysis 
(TNA) to form the basis for personalised 
Individual Development Plans (IDPs) for 
every team member.

Inclusive Benefits for an Evolving Workforce
Employee well-being is central to Max Estates’ ethos, 
focusing on physical, emotional, and professional 
wellness. This philosophy is reflected in thoughtfully 
designed benefit programmes that support all life-
stage needs, promote health, and facilitate a balanced 
work-life experience.
In FY2025, the employee benefits framework was 
strengthened with new offerings and higher uptake 
of existing policies. Paternity leave benefits were 
enhanced, with an increased utilisation during the 
year underscores a more inclusive, family-supportive 
culture. Employees approaching retirement now 
have the option to take advisory roles, helping retain 
institutional knowledge while ensuring smooth 
mentorship for our younger talent.
Hybrid and remote work arrangements are supported 
through department-specific hot desks, enhancing 
mobility across locations, including the Head Office. 
A satellite office in Gurugram makes collaboration 
easier for project-based teams in that area. The 
administration department works closely with Human 
Resources (HR), Information Technology (IT), and 
Security to ensure employees are supported across 
onboarding, seating arrangements, wellness activities, 
grievance resolution, workstations, transport safety, 
and CCTV management.
A dedicated WorkWell team drives year-round 
wellness-centric programmes, while independent 
employee satisfaction surveys track engagement, 
workplace wellness, and overall experience.
These initiatives have fostered a more inclusive 
workplace culture, improved talent diversity across 
geographies, and stronger employee satisfaction.
These evolving policies embed care and empathy into 
our workplace practices, helping employees navigate 
life transitions with dignity and support.

Parental Leave
Max Estates recognises that caregiving is a critical stage 
of life, and we approach it with empathy, flexibility, and 
support. In line with our people-first philosophy and 
commitment to inclusivity, our enhanced maternity and 
paternity leave policies in FY2024 led to a noticeable 
increase in adoption across the organisation.
To support new mothers in their transition back to work, 
we have established a flexible and accommodating work 
environment that enables them to care for themselves 
and their newborns while transitioning back into the 
workplace. Options to adjust work hours and work from 
any Max Estates office help make this return smoother.
Diversity, Equity 
and Inclusion (DEI)
Diversity at Max Estates is not a standalone goal. It is a 
key enabler of a collaborative, empathetic, and high-
performance culture. We are dedicated to fostering 
an inclusive workplace where diversity is valued and 
employees are empowered to grow and thrive.
With a target of 25% gender diversity, particularly in 
project execution teams, we are working to increase 
female representation in on-site roles through targeted 
initiatives, skills development, and a supportive work 
environment. Academic partnerships and mentorship 
programmes encourage young women to pursue 
careers in real estate.
To enhance understanding and drive change, we 
partnered with In Tandem Global Consulting to publish 
Concrete Change, a report highlighting the need for 
pay parity and inclusion in a sector that remains one of 
the least diverse for women.
DEI at Max Estates is a continuous journey. Anchored in 
data-driven interventions, proactive policy shifts, and 
inclusive leadership, we continue to address systemic 
barriers and promote fairness, opportunities, and 
representation across our ecosystem.
To further strengthen our support 
ecosystem, a Bereavement Leave 
policy was introduced, recognising 
the emotional and personal needs of 
employees during times of loss.

Occupational Health 
and Safety Management 
At Max Estates, its foundational priority is the safety, 
health, and well-being of every employee, worker, 
contractor, and visitor. The Company’s Occupational 
Health and Safety (OHS) framework is grounded 
in a proactive, systematic approach aligned with 
international standards, including ISO 45001 and ISO 
14001. This helps us anticipate risks, prevent incidents, 
and nurture a culture of continuous improvement 
across all offices and project sites.
All of its sites implement a structured 
Hazard Identification and Risk 
Assessment (HIRA) process, backed 
by thorough planning and control 
measures.
Hybrid and remote work arrangements are supported 
through department-specific hot desks, enhancing 
mobility across locations, including the Head Office. 
A satellite office in Gurugram makes collaboration 
easier for project-based teams in that area. The 
administration department works closely with Human 
Resources (HR), Information Technology (IT), and 
Security to ensure employees are supported across 
onboarding, seating arrangements, wellness activities, 
grievance resolution, workstations, transport safety, 
and CCTV management.
A dedicated WorkWell team drives year-round 
wellness-centric programmes, while independent 
employee satisfaction surveys track engagement, 
workplace wellness, and overall experience.
Through disciplined processes, close collaboration, 
and continuous monitoring, we are reinforcing a 
zero-harm culture and keeping all offerings safe and 
creating a secure space for all.
Max Estates have institutionalised oversight through 
a dedicated Safety Committee that actively monitors, 
reports, and reviews site performance metrics. 
We have also engaged Bureau Veritas (BVI) as 
an independent third-party auditor to assess the 
effectiveness of our health and safety controls.

Urban Spaces

NATURAL CAPITAL
We see the environment as a part of our shared home, and caring for it is at the heart of Max Estates, 
particularly in today’s world. Every choice we make seeks to reduce our environmental footprint while leaving 
a healthier planet for the future. We continue to focus on resource conservation in areas like energy, water, and 
waste, as well as biodiversity, which has positioned us as a leader in sustainable development. 
Our WorkWell and LiveWell philosophy blends well-being with ecology together, inspiring us to continuously 
advance sustainable building practices in every project.
Our efforts are reflected in 
milestones, including attaining 
a 4-star rating under the 
GRESB framework in 2024 and 
adopting ISO 14001:2015 to 
strengthen our environmental 
management.
Through independent assurance audits for energy, 
water, and waste data, and Net Zero roadmap under 
progress built on digital-first solutions, we are 
committed to green building with USGBC LEED-
certified strategies and WELL/IGBC Certification for 
Health & Well-being.
Every project is an opportunity to leave a positive 
footprint. By weaving ecological considerations into 
urban design, we aim to create spaces where both 
nature and communities grow side by side.

Natural Harmony Interwoven 
in Every Space
Sustainable Procurement 
and Circular Economy
We choose materials with care for both people and the 
planet. Guided by IGBC/LEED guidelines, we prioritise 
green-certified, low-VOC products and prefer local 
suppliers to minimise logistics emissions and support 
local economies. Recycled materials like fly ash bricks, 
reclaimed steel, and concrete are now common. In 
some projects, we are exploring local alternatives to 
imported marble to help reduce embodied carbon. 
Next year, a detailed Product Design Guideline 
will provide us with clear direction to strengthen 
sustainable practices. 
We embrace a circular-resource mindset by prioritising 
the principles of reduce, reuse, and recycle. Reusing 
materials on-site, such as dismantled exhibition 
structures, is common practice. Our Circular Economy 
Policy highlights the importance of cutting waste and 
repurposing materials, helping us embed sustainability 
in our everyday business.
Key initiatives and impacts:
Sustainability and natural harmony lie at the heart 
of Max Estates’ identity, influencing every part of 
our design, delivery, and operations. Guided by our 
philosophy, our buildings use MERV-13 air filtration, 
UV filters, continuous air monitoring, and biophilic 
elements to support health, comfort, productivity 
and well-being. Our health and safety protocols 
are aligned with WELL and IGBC/LEED standards, 
always learning and improving through audits and 
feedback. Each project teaches us how to do better, 
from construction to service quality while exploring 
new technologies. To reduce our carbon footprint, 
we rely on e-approvals, digital recordkeeping, 
and virtual meetings. Energy usage is monitored 
through audits, and authorised recyclers safely 
handle electronic and hazardous waste such as lube 
oil, batteries, etc. Small steps, such as careful use of 
color printers and replacing single use plastic items, 
further support sustainability efforts.
Max Estates shows its commitment to resource 
conservation, with a focus on energy and water 
efficiency. We are also creating healthy indoor 
environments by optimising airflow, lightning, 
and natural light. Green materials and regular 
maintenance help us maintain comfort and 
sustainability. Low-VOC paints sourced locally 
support community health, while our biophilic 
designs foster a connection to nature. In-person 
and 3D virtual tours show our spaces in action, 
reflecting the well-being of occupants through our 
WorkWell philosophy and the Pulse programme.

Integrated Report 2024-25
Our Energy Management System is designed to 
abide by global ISO principles and incorporates 
systematic Energy Performance Indicators (EnPIs), 
audits, targets, and continuous improvement 
cycles. Our policies address energy consumption, 
renewable energy, pollution control, and GHG 
emission reduction, while we actively access Scope 
3 emissions as part of its Net Zero roadmap. Our 
commitment to energy and resource efficiency 
is reflected in its LEED/IGBC-certified assets, 
including Max Towers, Max House, and Max Square. 
Our integrated approach has reduced energy use, 
lowered HVAC loads, and cut operational costs, as 
confirmed by internal audits and ESG dashboards.
Guided by our formal Waste Management 
Policy, we comply with Central and State 
regulations, spanning solid waste, plastic 
waste, construction and demolition waste, 
e-waste, hazardous waste, and battery 
waste. Max Estates’ cross-functional ESG 
governance ensures that policies are 
followed from design to daily operations. 
Through team training, clear signage, and 
regular audits, we make accountability 
simple and consistent.

We prioritise sorting waste at its source, from 
biodegradable and recyclable materials to 
construction and demolition (C&D) debris, 
e-waste, batteries, and used oil. Our goal 
is zero landfill across all properties, and 
we ensure that 100% of all e-waste and 
hazardous waste, such as lubricant oil and 
batteries, is responsibly recycled through 
systems that comply with all regulations.
Organic waste converters are installed at 
operational sites, transforming food waste 
into rich compost that nourishes its green 
cover and completes the nutrient loop. 
On-site composting has been seamlessly 
integrated into its circular economy 
framework. We have completely phased 
out single-use plastic bottles, opting for 
glass alternatives as the standard across our 
commercial and residential assets.
We design with modularity and focus on 
deconstruction-friendly infrastructure to 
minimise demolition waste. Temporary 
structures, like show units, are given a second 
life as permanent site facilities. By utilising 
recovered materials, such as steel, concrete, 
and fly ash bricks, we’re committed to cutting 
down our embodied carbon footprint.

Water Management
At Max Estates, responsible water stewardship is a critical part of its sustainability blueprint. With an awareness 
of the urgent challenges of water scarcity and pollution both in India and worldwide, we have embraced a 
thoughtful, proactive and systematic approach to conserving, reusing, and optimising water resources. Our 
ambition is to build urban spaces that are resilient to water-related challenges, minimise reliance on external 
sources, nurture surrounding ecosystems, and foster long-term climate resilience.

Our Water Consumption Policy supports the 
efficient use of water, ensuring that every drop 
is used wisely, across construction to daily 
practices alike. We keep a close eye on water 
usage, identify areas with high consumption, and 
implement strategies for reducing usage in line 
with our sustainability objectives and Net Zero 
goals. Oversight of water management is built 
into our broader ESG governance, helping us stay 
compliant with relevant environmental laws while 
contributing to national water conservation efforts.
Every Max Estates development reflects the 
philosophy that built spaces should harmonise 
and not burden natural ecosystems. Our 
water-sensitive urban design keeps operations 
efficient while protecting and conserving 
water, supporting our long-term water security 
in its regions where we operate.
Water Consumption Policy and 
Strategic Oversight
We have introduced a suite of water-efficient 
technologies and sustainable design strategies 
across our developments, aiming to lower our 
water footprint while meeting the daily needs 
of tenants and users. Our measures focus 
on improving demand-side efficiency and 
strengthening supply-side augmentation.
Sustainable Water 
Infrastructure
Key interventions include:
Max Estates reports 100% water recycling 
across the entire portfolio. All facilities have 
achieved zero liquid discharge, with treated 
wastewater being fully reused for flushing and 
landscaping. Out of 112,450 litres of water used 
in FY2025, around 15% (16,830 litres) came 
from STP recycled water.  Rainwater harvesting, 
efficient waste management and 100% waste 
diversion from landfills are standard. We aim 
to earn a 5-star GRESB rating, building on our 
4-star achievement in 2023 while we ensure a 
Green Building certification for all our assets.
Low-flow Water Fixtures:
Use of low-flow faucets, waterless urinals, and 
pressure-regulated fixtures in all washrooms to 
cut water consumption at the source.
Zero Liquid Discharge (ZLD):
All our projects follow a ZLD model, ensuring 
no untreated wastewater is released. Sewage is 
treated and reused within premises, dramatically 
lowering freshwater withdrawal.
High-Capacity Sewage Treatment Plants (STPs):
	»
Max Square: 375 KLD STP
	»
Max Towers: 100 KLD STP
	»
Max House: 70 KLD MBBR technology STP with 
UV treatment
Greywater Recycling:
Treated greywater is used for flushing and 
landscaping, easing demand on potable water usage.
Rainwater Harvesting:
Installed across multiple developments, 
rainwater is collected and stored for reuse in 
irrigation and other non-potable uses.
Smart Metering:
Floor-wise meters lets us track water usage in 
real-time which helps us detect anomalies, and 
optimise every drop.
Irrigation Management:
Landscaped areas use drip irrigation and 
sprinklers, which cut water use compared to 
traditional watering systems.

Our Biodiversity Policy commits to protecting, 
restoring, and enriching natural habitats across all 
our developments, making environmental care a core 
part of what we do. Guided by our ESG vision and 
the WorkWell and LiveWell philosophies, the policy 
is put into practice through careful oversight and 
governance. Our objective is to preserve and enhance 
native flora and fauna within and around project sites. 
We go a step further by weaving biophilic design and 
green corridors into master plans to foster ecological 
connectivity. Native plant species bloom on our green 
roofs, while natural stormwater features nurture urban 
wildlife, creating vibrant, living landscapes. We are 
aligned with global frameworks, such as the UN SDGs, 
especially SDG 15 as our biodiversity action plans, 
GRESB recommendations, and local conservation 
efforts make every site a place where people coexist 
with nature. This policy applies to all our Max Estates 
developments across commercial, residential, and 
mixed-use segments.
Max Estates actively seeks partnerships and initiatives 
that enhance our natural capital stewardship. 
Greywater recycling, community alliances, and 
collaborative innovation, all work together to advance 
and scale our sustainability efforts. We nurture natural 
capital while striving to reach net-zero-ready spaces for 
the future.

and nature, making it a key aspect of our work-life balance.

vegetation, offering moments of calm and connection amid busy 
days. Our pesticide-free approach protects local ecosystems 
and improves plant health. We take pride in nurturing both our 
internal green spaces and the surrounding landscape, creating 
developments that uplift both people and nature.
We are committed to growing our impact in real estate by making environmental stewardship a core part 
of how we operate. Clear, measurable, and forward-looking targets help us focus on deeply embedding ESG 
principles into our practices by using a centralised dashboard that helps us track environmental metrics in 
real-time across our portfolio. This helps us make informed choices, take data-driven decisions and manage 
risks for a more sustainable future.
Looking ahead, Max Estates’ environmental roadmap includes the following key initiatives:
Max Estates is shaping urban development by combining design-led execution with a strong commitment 
to well-being and environmental stewardship. Grounded by our WorkWell and LiveWell philosophies, we will 
continue to strengthen our capabilities across the real estate value chain. This includes investing in digital 
tools, embedding sustainable systems, and creating spaces where genuine well-being remains at the heart 
of every human experience.

SOCIAL AND RELATIONSHIP CAPITAL
At Max Estates, we are dedicated to building vibrant and inclusive communities while fostering 
relationships that last. Guided by a people-first philosophy, we engage meaningfully with everyone 
connected to our work, including our construction workers, supply chain partners, residents, channel 
partners, and our surrounding communities. Through need-based assessments, local consultations, and 
well-planned CSR initiatives, we aim to uplift the ecosystems we work in while keeping disruption to a 
minimum during project delivery. 
We set high standards for our supply chain by partnering with only ethical vendors who share our 
commitment to transparency, quality, and sustainability. 
Our procurement practices abide by ESG principles that 
ensure fair labor practices, safe workplaces, and the 
creation of local jobs whenever possible.
Each project reflects our belief in social value. This includes inclusive design, open green 
spaces, the beautification of underpasses, and public art initiatives that add character to 
urban experiences. By weaving empathy, equity, and excellence into every interaction, we’re 
building more than real estate spaces. We’re building trust,  dignity, and a brighter future for 
everyone in our ecosystem.

Max India Foundation (SEE Learning)
Max India Foundation is committed to nurturing 
human potential and building an inclusive future. 
In partnership with Emory University in the United 
States, we have brought the globally recognised 
Social, Emotional, and Ethical (SEE) Learning 
programme to India. This initiative is delivered 
through SEE Learning India, an organisation that is 
spearheading the programme across the nation.
Developed by Emory University’s Centre for 
Contemplative Science and Compassion-Based 
Ethics, SEE Learning is a K–12 educational 
framework that brings social-emotional 
competencies, ethical literacy, and systems thinking 
into everyday education. It goes beyond traditional 
Social-Emotional Learning (SEL), with a focus on 
compassion, resilience, moral discernment, and 
global citizenship. The aim is to prepare students 
not only to succeed but to thrive with purpose 
and empathy.
Through SEE Learning India, Max India Foundation 
helps in adapting and localising the programme for 
the Indian context. The initiative focuses on:
	»
Training educators and school leaders through 
workshops, facilitator programmes, and 
ongoing support.
	»
Partnering with schools, educational boards, and 
NGOs to widen reach and enhance our impact.
	»
Bringing SEE Learning into classrooms to 
cultivate emotionally intelligent, ethically aware, 
and socially responsible student communities.
SEE Learning India has already connected with 
hundreds of schools and educators across the 
country, creating safe and nurturing learning 
spaces that encourage well-being, teamwork, and 
mindful engagement.

Collaboration with Habitat  
for Humanity
At Max Estates, our commitment to inclusive growth 
goes beyond the boundaries of our offerings. In 
partnership with Habitat for Humanity India, we 
are transforming lives by supporting access to 
safe and dignified housing for underprivileged 
communities, particularly construction workers and 
laborers who form the backbone of our thoughtfully 
designed spaces.
Through this collaboration, a portion of each unit sold 
at Estate 128 helps sponsor homes for economically 
disadvantaged families. This initiative tackles unsafe 
living conditions and related health risks among low-
income construction workers, with the broader aim 
of fostering social equity and well-being.
We are committed to building 50 homes in 
two phases:
	»
Phase I: Successfully completed, with 25 homes 
handed over in Rewari, Haryana, marking a key 
milestone in our social impact journey.
	»
Phase II: We’re building the next 25 homes, 
keeping up with our promise of providing secure 
and sustainable housing.
Looking ahead, we are exploring ways to further 
this initiative to the Noida region, in line with 
our development footprint and commitment to 
uplift communities.
Latika Centre for Inclusion, 
Roy Memorial Foundation
At Max Estates, inclusivity is at the heart of 
what we do. It’s a tangible design principle that 
ensures we create spaces for people across all 
abilities. We partnered with Latika Centre for 
Inclusion, Roy Memorial Foundation, a non-profit 
organisation dedicated to empower people with 
special needs through education, therapy, and 
community activities.
Together with Latika, we are supporting the 
creation of the “Centre for Inclusion and Influence,” 
a 56,000-square-foot campus where accessibility 
meets well-being. Purpose-built with universal 
design principles, the centre will offer a welcoming, 
functional, and empowering space for people 
with disabilities, their families, and everyone in 
the community.
The campus will include:
	»
Therapy and counselling spaces
	»
Physiotherapy and sensory stimulation areas
	»
Activity rooms and training halls
	»
A family resource centre and an inclusive library
	»
An accessible playground
	»
Ramp-friendly movement across all zones
This partnership is helping us to curate inclusive 
spaces that embrace diversity, encourage equity, 
and inspire socially responsible development 
in India.
Pulse Community Events
At Max Estates, we design spaces that bring people 
together, focus on well-being, and foster a sense 
of belonging. Pulse, our in-house engagement 
initiative, offers immersive community experiences for 
commercial and residential occupants.
In FY2025, Pulse hosted over 200 
events, engaging more than 8,400 
tenants and residents through a 
thoughtfully curated mix of wellness 
workshops, cultural celebrations, 
food pop-ups, fitness sessions, 
sustainability initiatives, and 
educational experiences.
From morning yoga sessions and festive décor 
workshops to expert-led talks and live performances, 
each event aimed to energise participants, build 
community, and inspire healthier, happier lifestyles.
These initiatives showed a real impact, with a Net 
Promoter Score (NPS) of 6.9 out of 10, reflecting high 
occupant satisfaction and brand loyalty. Through Pulse, 
we are bringing our LiveWell and WorkWell philosophy 
to life by creating people-first experiences that go 
beyond mere brick and mortar.
Scholarship Scheme
Max Estates, through the Max India Foundation, 
supports education with scholarships to students 
from underprivileged backgrounds. In FY2025, our 
partnerships with 12 NGOs helped over 1,04,000 
students and more than 2,300 teachers benefitted 
from scholarships and skill-development programmes.
Community Health Camps
We host regular health camps for construction 
workers and local communities near our 
developments. These cover screenings, preventive 
care, and wellness workshops help address critical 
health needs among labourers and their neighbours, 
reinstating our commitment to community well-
being.
Skill India Partnership
Through our partnerships with Skill India-aligned 
organisations to provide vocational training in trades 
such as construction support, facility management, 
and hospitality. These programmes help local youth 
and workers gain industry-relevant skills and build 
brighter employment opportunities.
Community Welfare Initiatives
We work alongside local authorities and contractors 
to uplift marginalised communities. We delivered 
25 homes for construction workers in Rewari 
(Phase I) and are building 25 more, supported by a 
portion of the sales from Estate 128. At the same 
time, we have conducted pavement rehabilitation 
and beautification projects around Max Towers and 
Max House, creating healthier, cleaner and more 
welcoming spaces for everyone.

Elevating Customer Experiences Through Spaces
Sourcing with Purpose, Building with Integrity  
At Max Estates, customer experience is central to our 
WorkWell and LiveWell philosophy. Every interaction 
is part of a long-term relationship built on care, 
transparency, and responsiveness. Our offerings are 
designed to elevate everyday life with intentional 
design, biophilic thinking, and wellness while 
fostering meaningful engagement throughout the 
customer lifecycle.
We adopt a full-lifecycle approach to customer 
engagement, beginning with immersive pre-sales 
experiences and extending through to handover, 
community living, and repeat investment. Our 
Salesforce (SFDC)-powered CRM, integrated with SAP 
to automate client onboarding, documentation, and 
communications. Every client receives a welcome call 
within 24 hours, a welcome e-mail within three days, 
an allotment letter within 10 days, and an Agreement 
for Sale within 21 days of booking, keeping the process 
simple, timely and transparent.
We enhance client engagement through LiveWell 
Socials, a calendar of wellness events, curated gifting, 
and milestone communication. Thoughtful items, 
such as yoga mats, terrariums, and eco-friendly 
water bottles, reinforce the brand's values while 
creating memorable experiences. CRM, Pulse, and 
marketing teams work in harmony to make every 
interaction meaningful. 
Our CRM segmentation is carried out by property 
type, customer value, geography, and interests. We 
actively gather customer feedback collected through 
structured forms after experience centre visits to 
Max Estates adheres to a high-integrity Sourcing 
Policy, favouring local materials to lower transport 
emissions and selecting green-certified materials, such 
as low-VOC paints and GreenPro-accredited products, 
to minimise embodied carbon. These decisions not 
only uphold global green-building guidelines but 
also support regional communities, contributing 
to local economic well-being while meeting our 
sustainability goals.
Sustainable Procurement
Our Procurement Policy emphasises sourcing goods 
and services that are environmentally friendly, locally 
sourced, and low-carbon. This sustainable approach 
prioritises the well-being of communities and aligns 
with our vision of achieving sustainable development 
through low-impact initiatives. Extraction, production, 
and transport of raw materials used in construction 
require significant energy, often from fossil fuels. 
By reusing and recycling materials, we reduce the 
demand for virgin resources, lower embodied carbon, 
and cut the energy needed for material production, 
contributing to a smaller carbon footprint. Recycling 
steel, aluminium, and concrete saves far more energy 
than producing them from raw resources.
We choose materials with care, following international 
guidelines on green building standards and favouring 
local sourcing of products and materials. With 
this small step, we support the local economy and 
make a small but relevant impact in reducing our 
transportation footprint. Our execution process also 
backs the broader ESG and community development 
goals, such as local employment, resource efficiency, 
and environmentally responsible practices.
Supplier Engagement and 
Capacity Building
We proactively partner with our vendors through 
regular training and performance alignment 
forums. Our Sustainable Procurement Policy sets 
clear expectations with our suppliers to respect the 
environmental, labor, and safety principles, with

Vendors, Distributors and 
Supply Chain Management
Max Estates follows a thorough vendor selection 
process that includes detailed evaluations and 
commercial benchmarks. We assess each vendor's 
technical capabilities, financial health, and compliance. 
To reduce risks, we maintain a multiple-supplier 
strategy. Vendors are evaluated on quality, working 
methods, safety protocols, and compliance to standard 
operating procedures across 13 sectors. This approach 
helps us build a supply chain we can trust.
Contract and Service-level Agreement (SLA) 
management ensures the necessary services, such 
as housekeeping, transport, catering, and facility 
management are delivered by a list of qualified and 
trusted vendors based on experience, capabilities, and 
pricing. It's essential to verify regulatory compliance, 
including GST and PAN, and to clearly define the scope 
of work before finalising contracts.
We track key performance metrics, such as on-time 
delivery and adherence to standards, and track cost 
variances that ensure financial accountability. We 
have set Key Result Areas (KRAs) that help us evaluate 
our performance, pushing us to consistently exceed 
expectations. Regular audits and performance 
reviews help us maintain accountability while keeping 
sustainable, low-impact development at the heart of 
our operations.

Mr. Analjit Singh 
Founder and Chairman, Max Group
Analjit Singh is the Founder and Chairman of The Max Group, a 
prominent Indian multi-business enterprise with interests in life 
insurance (Max Life), real estate (Max Estates), and senior care (Antara). 
He is the Chairman of the listed companies of Max Group, viz., Max 
Financial Services Limited, Max India Limited and Max Estates Limited 
and earlier, the Founder Chairman of Max Life Insurance Company 
Limited; Max Healthcare; Hutchison Max Telecom; Max Bupa and 
so on.  
  
Over his 40-year career, Mr. Singh has transformed various sectors, 
including telecom, healthcare, life insurance, and real estate in 
India. A self-made entrepreneur, Mr. Singh was awarded the Padma 
Bhushan and holds degrees from The Doon School, Shri Ram College 
of Commerce, and an MBA from Boston University. Mr. Singh founded 
the Leeu Collection, which includes boutique hotels in South Africa, 
the UK, and Italy, alongside a wine business and various restaurant 
partnerships. Mr. Analjit Singh was a member of the Founder 
Executive Board of the Indian School of Business (ISB), He was also 
the non-executive Chairman of Vodafone India until August 2018 and 
served as a Director on the Board of Sofina NV/SA, Belgium till March 
2022. He also serves as the Honorary Consul General of the Republic 
of San Marino in India.

Alternate director to Mr. Anthony R. Malloy

Alternative Strategy at New York Life Insurance Company, responsible for 
investment strategy, asset allocation, and dynamic portfolio management 
of the company’s general account and alternatives portfolio assets and 
performance metrics. Ms. Moo-Young joined New York Life in 2023 and 
has almost 32 years of investment management and financial services 
experience. She has held senior leadership roles at American International 
Group/Corebridge Financial, AIG Investments and Bank of America Merrill 
Lynch. Ms. Moo-Young earned a BA in Economics from Columbia University,

Manufacturing Services (EMS) industry, with over 31 years of experience in

Board Committees
The effectiveness of Max Estates’ governance framework is reinforced by a series of well-structured committees of 
the Board. Each committee is entrusted with specific responsibilities, providing focused oversight on key aspects 
of the Company’s operations. Through regular deliberations and robust review mechanisms, these committees 
ensure adherence to regulatory requirements, alignment with strategic objectives, and accountability to 
stakeholders. Collectively, they strengthen the Board’s ability to guide the Company with discipline, transparency, 
and foresight.
Policies and Code of Conduct
Max Estates upholds the highest standards of governance and ethical conduct through a robust framework of 
policies, codes, and procedures that guide its operations and stakeholder engagement. To ensure compliance with 
legal and ethical standards, the Company has in place a comprehensive set of corporate codes and policies, all of 
which are available in the Corporate Governance section of the Company’s website: https://maxestates.in/investors.

Proactive 
Risk Stewardship
RISK MANAGEMENT
At Max Estates, we see risk management as an integral part of how we work and make decisions. As 
we grow across the Delhi-NCR region, we navigate a wide and evolving range of risks, from regulatory 
changes and environmental factors to economic shifts and challenges to our reputation. To stay ahead, 
we keep our approach dynamic, updating our strategies to match changing realities while staying true to 
our strategic goals, operational resilience, and the trust of our stakeholders. 
Strong risk management not only safeguards value. It also creates space for sustainable growth. Our 
approach lays equal emphasis on spotting potential risks early and responding with agility. This helps us 
remain prepared for disruptions while continuing to create thoughtful spaces that stand the test of time.
Risk Management Framework
Our risk management framework is designed for strong cross-functional coordination. This ensures 
that potential risks are identified, escalated, and mitigated effectively in every part of our operations. 
The framework covers a wide range of areas, including operational hazards, supply chain bottlenecks, 
regulatory compliance, and matters affecting our reputation. 
Risk Governance Process
ESTATE 360 
Artistic Rendition
Layers of Risk Governance
Risk Register Update – 
Quarterly
Every quarter, the risk 
register SPOC undertakes a 
cycle of updates to the risk 
register in collaboration with 
the respective functional 
owners of the risk buckets.
Functional Risk Review – Monthly
During the functional reviews held every 
month with the CEO and COO, all functions 
review the key risks and the respective 
mitigation strategies.
Cross Functional Risk Review – Weekly
As part of the weekly cross-functional forum held every 
Monday morning, the key risks are brought in turn for a 
cross-functional review of the mitigation plan.
Risk Committee Review – Biannually
Every six months, the red flags for the Company are 
reviewed as part of the risk committee meeting to 
seek the committee’s guidance on the way forward.

MAX ESTATES LIMITED
Identification
We actively identify risks through ongoing 
analysis and real-time monitoring, ensuring 
we catch issues early and act promptly.
Mitigation
We act quickly to contain risks while building 
stronger systems for the future. Mitigation is 
part of how we work every day.
Escalation
We have a clear, multi-layered escalation framework 
to keep risk management proactive and responsive.
Risk Register 
Each department maintains an updated Risk 
Register through regular SWOT analyses. Each 
risk is assessed for how soon it might occur, 
how likely it is, and its impact and severity.
Real-time Monitoring 
An external partner manages a dedicated 
Online Reputation Management (ORM) tracker 
that monitors digital platforms round the clock. 
It swiftly flags potential reputation concerns, 
such as negative press, viral complaints, or 
social media backlash, enabling prompt action.
This approach supports Max Estates in protecting 
operations, safeguarding stakeholders, and continuing 
as a responsible leader in India’s real estate sector.
Digitalisation 
Upgrading digital tools to automate compliance 
workflows, monitoring related party transactions (RPT), 
and controlling insider trading.
Independent Oversight 
Independent audits for related-party transactions 
will ensure greater transparency.
Broadened Risk Culture 
We aim to build a stronger risk-aware mindset 
across business planning, day-to-day operations, and 
stakeholder communications.
Short-term Response 
When negative press or a social backlash hits, 
we run our rapid response playbook, with social 
media containment, clear official press lines, and 
customer grievance redressal mechanisms.
Long-term Measures 
We use trends from the Risk Register to guide 
longer-term strategies, such as reshaping policy, 
enhancing stakeholder engagement, and 
strengthening our business continuity plans.
Operational Hazards and Vendor Risks 
We review operational hazards, supply chain 
dependencies and vendor risks continuously. 
Mitigation is embedded in project delivery, 
vendor selection and contract clauses so risk is 
managed at source.
Strengthening Governance
We are sharpening our risk governance with 
clear, focused steps:
ESTATE 360 
Artistic Rendition
Structured Protocols 
High-severity risks, especially those that can affect 
reputation, are escalated immediately to cross-
functional teams through well-established procedures.
Monthly Risk Reviews 
In monthly functional reviews with the CEO and COO, 
each function reviews its key risks and the mitigation 
strategies in place.
Quarterly Risk Reviews 
Every quarter, our leadership reviews the Company’s risk 
register, ensuring ongoing oversight and reprioritisation 
of risks with the changing business environment.
Weekly Risk Reviews 
In the weekly cross-functional forum held every Monday 
morning, teams bring forward their key risks in turn for 
review and discussion on mitigation plans.
Biannual Risk Committee Review 
Every six months, the Company’s red flags 
are presented to the risk committee to seek 
their guidance on the way forward.

Management 
Discussion & Analysis
MAX SQUARE, NOIDA  
Actual Image
Max Estates: Positioned to Lead the Next Phase of Real Estate Growth in NCR
Bringing Real Well-being to Real Estate
FY2025 marked a significant phase of growth for Max 
Estates, reaffirming the company’s strong conviction in 
the real estate opportunity within Delhi-NCR. Staying 
true to its core philosophies of WorkWell & LiveWell, the 
company continued its strategic trajectory—expanding 
its development portfolio from 8 million square feet in 
FY2024 to over 17 million square feet in FY2025 across 
residential, commercial, and mixed-use segments.
This year was particularly notable as the company 
entered the mixed-use development space through 
two marquee acquisitions, furthering its vision of 
delivering differentiated real estate experiences 
that integrate cutting-edge design with exceptional 
hospitality and a focus on wellbeing.
Strategic Acquisitions: Driving Portfolio Growth
Max Estates made bold, forward-looking moves in 
FY2025, acquiring prime land parcels and development 
rights across Delhi-NCR with the following acquisitions:
Delhi One, Sector 16B, Noida – The Company 
successfully acquired the Delhi One project after 
receiving final approvals under the Insolvency & 
Bankruptcy Code from Hon’ble NCLT and Hon’ble 
NCLAT in February 2023 and October 2024, 
respectively. The project is an integrated mixed-use 
development that will have ultra-luxury serviced 
residences, premium office spaces, and retail 
spaces. This strategic acquisition offers significant 
development potential of about 2.5 million square feet, 
inclusive of already sold units. The project is expected 
to generate a total sales potential of approximately 
₹2,000 crore, along with an annuity rental income 
potential of around ₹120 crore.
Sector 105, Noida – Marking the first acquisition under 
government auction, the Company acquired a 10.33-
acre parcel along the Noida-Greater Noida Expressway 
for ₹711 crore through a competitive auction. It has a 
development potential of 2.6 million square feet with 
40 per cent residential (group housing) and 60 per cent 
commercial (including office and retail). The project 
has a Gross Development Value (GDV) potential of 
over approximately ₹2,500 crore and an annuity rental 
income potential of more than ₹140 crore.
Estate 361, Sector 36A, Gurugram – Adjacent to its 
flagship residential project Estate 360 in Gurugram, the 
company acquired an 18-acre residential parcel with 
development potential of 4 mn square feet, expanding 
its footprint to nearly 30 acres in this emerging luxury 
corridor on the Dwarka Expressway. Estate 361 adds a 
GDV potential of ₹9,000 crore, bringing the combined 
Gurugram development potential to over ₹13,000 
crore across 6.4 million square feet.
Together, these acquisitions expanded the company’s 
total portfolio to 17 million square feet, laying a 
strong foundation for its long-term growth strategy of 
adding at least 3 million square feet of development 
portfolio annually across residential and commercial 
asset classes.
FY2025 Marks a Milestone Year of Execution at 
Scale and Robust Pre-Sales
In FY2025, the company delivered strong operational 
performance across its portfolio. Estate 128, Noida, 
achieved Phase II bookings of ₹894 crore, exceeding its 
target of ₹800 crore. Spanning 10 acres, the project has 
now evolved into a fully integrated premium residential 
community with a total booking value clocked of~ 
₹2,734 crore and is 100 per cent sold. Estate 360 in 
Gurugram maintained strong momentum, recording 
₹4,634 crore in pre-sales with 96 per cent of the 
inventory sold. Between Estate 128 and Estate 360, the 
company did ₹980 Cr of collections.
In the commercial segment, Max Square in Noida—
designed around the theme “Where Nature Meets 
Work”—achieved over 99 per cent leasing across ~0.7 
million square feet, with rentals commanding a 30 per 
cent premium over the micro-market. Similarly, Max 
House Phase II in Okhla was fully leased at rentals 60 
per cent above the market average, underscoring the 
demand for well-designed, high-quality office spaces.
Backed by a strong team of a strand team of over 
200 full time professionals, a robust zero net-debt 
balance sheet, and technology-led operations with 
sustainability embedded at the core, the company is 
well-positioned to execute and operate at scale with 
four operational assets and construction progressing 
steadily on four large developments with three 
more currently in the design phase. Max Estates is 
strengthening its focus on the LiveWell and WorkWell 
philosophy, embedding it across every aspect — 
from location and design to operations, materials, 
and beyond.
